Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, great views, ideal location... but not a true hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cameron06820
Reviews.Content: OK, so the name says Marriott, but this is not a full service hotel. It's part of their condo, time-share vacation properties. You can't always get a room, but if they're available, grab 'em! The rooms are huge... big living room and separate bedroom, complete w kitchen. The waterfront views are to die for. The staff is very friendly and informed, especially helpful for visitors. The hotel is right at the entrance to the MBTA Blue line (from the airport) and five minutes walk to Faneuil Hall / Qunicy Market. Free wifi too. But there is no restaurant or room service. The breakfast service in a conference room is a token effort and doesn't offer much. Try one of the local diners in the area. All that said, this is property is a much better deal than any other Marriott property in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Colonial Center of Town”
Reviews.Author: disneydad331
Reviews.Content: The Custom House is a treasure in the center of town. The 1-bedroom villas are very spacious, and have high ceilings. The rooms were super clean, and everything very comfortable. The suite that I had, the TV cabinet (all built into the wall) was not located in an ideal location to the couch, but all TV's are flat panels and nice. Small kitchenettes with microwave, sink, and refrigerator. Not that I needed it but LOTS of closet space. The views are amazing, and security is tight with card access to get into the hotel and card access to use the elevators. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would return again. Tip for business travelers, Faneuil Hall doesn't open until around 10am, which isn't convenient for breakfast, but there is a Panera just a couple blocks away. There are MANY great restaurants in walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: brewski59
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend you consider the Marriott Custom House if you're staying in Boston on business or sight-seeing. The old building makes for an easy landmark at the end of a long day on the Freedom Trail. The rooms are not huge, but decorated nicely and there is a small kitchenette if you're staying longer and want breakfast on your own. The views are just spectacular from about the sixth floor up in all directions. The staff is top notch, and the place gleams all the time. I enjoy being a few steps from Quincy Market and right around the corner from a number of busy Irish Pubs and nice restaurants. I especially like being just a short walk to the North End for dinner at one of the many wonderful Italian restaurants. And if you like to ride the T like I do, there is a station right out the door on the Blue Line. Overall, it's just a great property at a great location. I also like the Marriott Long Wharf across the street, but this trip that property was about $60/night more. The Long Wharf is a bit more tailored to business, but I like the Custom House better for location and it would make a better home base for families traveling on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Amanda Z
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to lots of tourist sights, many happening restaurants. The service was also very good, helpful front desk, valet. Far above the standards of a typical it's on a par with most Marriotts, but at a better price. Definitely recommended for location, comfort, cleanliness

Reviews.Title: “Great classic building and location”
Reviews.Author: FastEddddie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a very short business trip. This place seems to be right in the heart of it all, although I was here for business and not the sights. The building is a great classic old clock tower structure. Lots of ambience and history. I had a high floor corner suite. Nice room in many respects. However the fit and fixtures were not quite what I expected in terms of bathroom and kitchen fixtures and appliances. Ok, but not exactly luxurious. Also no desk in the living room to work at. Also the phone was not a speaker phone. And fairly weak wifi signal with low throughput. So not great for doing work in. Stopped by the bar on the 2nd floor when I got in. Not much of bar and didn't stay. Really missing something by not having a proper bar at this kind of place. I got downstairs to the breakfast room at 7am when they opened and the lady was just starting to put food out. Choices were somewhat limited. So... seems like a great vacation place, business, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay if you're in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: nerdalicious
Reviews.Content: I own a timeshare with Custom House and I don't regret ever owning it. It's like an apartment in Boston - there was a separate bedroom and a bathroom in the hallway from the living room. The living room was really spacious and I think the couch folds out into a bed but I wouldn't have had use for it as I stayed by myself. The room also had high ceilings and windows which was great so you could see the tops of the surrounding highrises. They definitely keep this hotel up nicely but I guess you can expect that for the money you are paying. I also like how they keep the place more secure at night by requiring you to slide your key to get into the lobby and slide your key to go up in the elevators. A nice thing about this hotel is that they have an observation deck on the 26th floor and you can definitely see a lot of downtown Boston and across the river. It was definitely one of the best views I have seen from a highrise building and was a nice touch considering my room was on the 5th floor. If you're in town and looking for a hidden gem, this is it! The Marriott Custom House is a beautiful place to stay at if you're looking to spend $500 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but should have listened to reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: L0vinVegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classic Boston. Very nostalgic, but updated, This is the palce to stay, if you want to be right in the thick of it. Very close to all the attractions, bars, restaurants, and sights. Stay here and there is no reason to drive anywhere. Only one issue, a lot of other reviews warn of noise in the late night hours, due to the bars. They were right, stayed two nights, and was woken up every night by the partying on the streets below. I strongly recommend staying on a higher floor, because you will be awaken by the late night partying.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Building and Great Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: johnfi
Reviews.Content: This is not your average hotel, in fact itâ€™s not a hotel but part of the Marriot Vacation Club properties (timeshare) and one of their only urban locations. The rooms are actually 1 bedroom villas with a bedroom and separate living room/kitchenette. Itâ€™s great for when you want more room than a typical hotel room with the living room and kitchenette (small fridge, microwave, bar sink and misc kitchen items â€“ blender, toaster, dishes and silverware). Rooms are nicely appointed and the building is so unique and full of history in a perfect location for seeing Boston. Yes is can be a little noisy on weekends as the next block has several busy bars, but it wasnâ€™t too bad but could be an issue on lower floors. The views are great and the higher you go the better. The bed was good but may be a little firm for some and didnâ€™t seem to be the typical Marriott mattress. It sounds like the villas are all great but we stayed in one of 2 Eagle Suites on the 21st floor and would have to say they were very special due to private the two private balconies. One balcony was fairly large (4â€™x20â€™) nestled between two of the Custom House Eagle statues on the side of the building that had an amazing view of the city and a smaller Balcony (2x4) overlooked Faneuil Hall and the North End. Even if you donâ€™t have your own private balconies the open air observation area on the 26th floor has got to be one of the best views of Boston and it has seats/tables to relax and watch the city and harbor. We will be back and already talking about brining family to visit to this property for a unique Boston experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with some downsides”
Reviews.Author: oxygen11
Reviews.Content: Great location and building. Certainly to remember. Rooms great, suites. Yet: breakfast very poor, and ony starting at 7am... weird hours. I guess more tuned toward vacationers. All in all, quite expensive for what you get. PS: check the lookout terrace, quite stunnig view 360 over Boston

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful historic building”
Reviews.Author: Ivela
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful historic building. There is an observatory where you can see the whole city from it. The location is perfect. You can walk everywhere. We did not try the restaurant. But there are so many good restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are very comfortable and the decor very elegant. It is pricey but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, cool hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: daphneNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: My family of four was looking for a place to stay the week between Christmas and New Year's. We looked around at a bunch of places. The issue was, with two teens, we needed two separate, adjoining rooms (but two hotel rooms x three days adds up to a lot) or a suite somewhere. Marriot's Custom House was far and away out best option. The suite is super-spacious, with a longish hallway separating the central area from the bedroom. Everything was comfortable and clean and we loved the kitchenette. Beyond that, it's a really interesting, old space --a domed lobby, a clock tower, an interesting mezzanine level where you can have tea and look out over cobble-stoned streets. I have never stayed in a hotel like this. Very special! Close to Quincy Market, Boston Aquarium, but somehow you don't feel like you're in a tourist trap. The 'T" is a stone's throw away, as is a quickmart-type place, where you can basic stuff like a banana. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: brigidsmom
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! It is always difficult as a family of 5 to find accommodations which will give us enough space. We love the set up of the rooms, one large space with a kitchenette and a living room with pull out sofa, a hallway where the bathroom is located then a bedroom with a separate door. So unusual to find a hotel with so much space right downtown! And the location...steps away from Quincy Market, and right across the street from the waterfront and museum. A short walk to the North End. My husband and kids loved going up to the observatory level (I skipped as I am afraid of heights!). There are only about 4 rooms on each level, there are times when we thought we were the only people staying here it was so quiet! Loved it here and would absolutely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Jayellbee
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this hotel has a wonderful central location. It is not a fancy hotel (don't expect Four Seasons), but there is absolutely nothing wrong with it. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms good sized and very clean. The views from the rooms are great but for an even better view, go to the observation tower on the ?29th floor where you have views in all 4 directions. When we were there earlier this month, they serve free homemade cookies around 5pm, and warmed mulled cider - yummm

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodations”
Reviews.Author: gbenchener
Reviews.Content: We loved the Marriott Custom House. The rooms are suites with federal period furniture and are impeccable. The staff is so accommodating. We did not have children on this trip, but if we did we would have liked their extra kid-friendly activities. A trip to the Boston Pops Holiday Show is a must in December. We loved the location -- subways are easy and the walking is terrific. Take the Freedom Trail right from the hotel. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: marilyn2354
Reviews.Content: My brother is a Mariott member and gave me a night here as a Christmas present. The room was a large suite of the 4th floor. The view was of the Quincy Market and its enormous Christams tree, just lovely! Check in was simple, early arrival was accomodated. Valet parking is pretty steep, $39.00 per night so I parked the car with them and never took it out again. The bed is super comfy. The workout room is adequate, no tv service this week however. There was a wine and cheese reception that night and I and my guests enjoyed a few glasses of wine and cheese and crackers prior to leaving for dinner. This was a very nice treat however a few of the guests were over the top, hogging tables, looking for extra drink tickets, etc. An after dinner drink in the bar was the only disappointment. An Irish coffee had very little alcohol and it was measured by a small jigger. Not a deal breaker but an annoyance. Thanks Bro!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: rayraymar
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, convenient location, big rooms! One block from Quincy Market where there is shopping and lots of restaurants, and close to the aquarium. The views from the hotel are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: aereo22
Reviews.Content: Across form Faneuil Hall, 2 blocks away from the aquarium and the Trolley tours, 3 blocks away from the Old House and the Boston massacre site, and walkable distance to Boston common. The T station is in front of the hotel, and if you got carry on only, you can be at the airport in less than 7 minutes, the Marriott Custom House is THE place to stay in Boston. The building is beautiful, the rooms are superb! A king size bed in the room and a Sofa which convert into a full size bed. A kitchenette with a small refrigerator and a microwave but with utensils to use for any leftovers or microwavable food. Hot apple cider and recently baked cookies every evening. Very friendly staff. The only downside is the "continental breakfast." Do not even try as it is extremely expensive and the "oriental lady" in charge there lacks of customer service skills in all senses, otherwise, do not hesitate to stay here! Don't forget to go up to the free observation deck for a extreme view of Boston, better view form there? I don think so and is free! We loved it and will not even think twice to choose this place again! Oh, and I did not experience any noise from any of the bars, and I was on the 6th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in location, rooms, and overall experience”
Reviews.Author: Fredonian
Reviews.Content: The Custom House, quite simply, is a very special place. My wife and I have visited regularly now for over a decade. Thanksgiving week was our third visit this year. The rooms are spacious and quite comfortable. There's a master bedroom, a bathroom, and a combination livingroom/dining room with limited kitchen facilities (including a microwave, a small refrigerator, a toaster, etc. along with glasses, cups, dishes, utensils, etc.). The couch in the livingroom turns into sleeping accommodations for two, so the unit sleeps four. The location really can't be beat. It's easy to get to and from via I-93 (the Big Dig) and access to the "T" is just steps away. It's even just a couple of stops away from Logan International on the T. The Custom House is adjacent to the Fanueil Hall/Qunicy Market area and close to the Haymarket Square area (a wonderful outdoor market that's open on Fridays and Saturdays) as well as being close to the North End and its restaurants and bakeries. The views from the various rooms are exceptional as are the views from the observation deck at the top of the building. All that being said, what makes the Custom House really special is its staff. They are marvelous--always welcoming and friendly and helpful. And there are many thoughtful and compelling amenities as well--things they don't have to do, but do to make the Custom House experience special. Many hotels make USA TODAY available. The Custom House delivers it to each door. On Sundays they make the Boston Globe available (while supplies last) at the front desk. They bake cookies at the front desk late each afternoon (and they're good!). During the late fall and winter, hot cider is available in the lobby--a very nice touch. Complimentary coffee is available in the Counting Room each morning, plus there's a slate of excellent entertainers available many nights, also in the Counting Room. The concierge staff is excellent, providing the sorts of services one would expect (but all too often doesn't get), but also offering orientations to the Boston area and beyond as well as tours of the facility itself. Another example of a nice touch. Just before Thanksgiving, a truly beautiful Christmas tree was placed in the center of the round lobby. It's just spectacular--perfect for the location, very tastefully done. It's hard to beat the quality of the experience the Custom House offers.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Custom House is a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLovesBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights in the Marriott Custom House this past week and loved the hotel. It was spacious with a fantastic view from the all our rooms and a breathtaking view from the observation deck. We had a sitting area, large bathroom, bedroom plus a set up with small sink, microwave, refrigerator and dishes, glasses, etc for four. The room was perfect. The service was spectacular. Everyone was friendly and addressed us each and everytime they saw us. There is a continental breakfast with cereal, waffles, bagles, danish, juices and coffee. You only pay for what you eat and it is so reasonably prices. The coffee and tea are free. I highly recommend this hotel which is near Fanuel Hall and the North End.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Seeing Boston”
Reviews.Author: csmith707
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for seeing Boston. The hotel is art of the Marriott vacation properties and as such a very comfortable place to stay. The staff is friendly, the room spotless and the views great. It is located in the historic Custom House across the street from Faneuil Hall. Five blocks to the entrance to the North End with great Italian restaurants, our favorite is Lucia's on Hanover Street. Across from the entrance to the hotel is the Aquarium stop on the MBTA so access to all of Boston is just steps away. My wife and I are already planning our return to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular View and Historical Building”
Reviews.Author: bekurt
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. We stayed in the guest room villa and it looked just like their website. I accomodated 5 adults very comfortably (one adult was on a high-end rollway bed, two adults on the sofa sleeper, and two adults in the bedroom). The staff was very polite and helpful. We arrived very late (about midnight) and the main entrance door was locked. It was a little tricky to find the side "door", but we appreciated the "safety". The locatiion of this hotel is great because you can walk or take public transportation (no rental car was needed). In the evenings, you could walk to a local pub. A family member ran the Boston Marathon and we were unable to get a hotel at the finish line, but this hotel ended up working great!

Reviews.Title: “Fine location for sightseeing, unique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Aparticulartguest
Reviews.Content: I stayed with family- myself, husband and 1 child. The suite layout was just perfect. Bedroom was separated from living area which had a pull out sofabed. Bath had an entrance from the living area and 1 from the bed room. Kitchenette was very handy to have, small fridge, microwave, coffee pot, and all the dishes we needed. We were able to do our own breakfasts in room which was easy and convenient. There is a 24 hr convenience store right outside the hotel that had ceral milk bread etc. Fanueil hall market just steps away for Starbucks etc from Breakfast. Bath and toiletries were serviceable but not special- toiletries low end, I visited a local pharmacy to get my own. Bath/shower combo toilet and sink with enough counter space to make do. Bed linens were fine and very comfy, more than enough closet space, good tv in each room, decor quite pleasant, blinds blocked the light quite nicely. High ceilings made the room be seem very airy. We used the gym (adequate- we were the only people there each time), laundry facility, pool at the Marriott Long wharf (ask at the front desk for a key, short walk to the Long Wharf). Housekeeping was good, my requests for extra blankets and towels met with no problem. A/c was great, kept it nice and cool in the room and we were having a warm spell in September. Downside, the one thermostat controlled both rooms. I really liked to location, close to fanueil hall, t stop just outside door, North end and downtown crossing shopping in walking distance. Ok, now for the one downside. The noise on week end nights. The place is surrounded by bars which are NOISY until the police chase everybody home at 2 am. We were on floor 4 or 5, so maybe its better up higher. Thur, Fri, and Sat nights we were kept up from 12 until 2 am. Sunday night was quiet enough. It was a big concern for us, maybe its OK if you are less sensitivive to noise, we don't live in a noisy part of a city so are used to total quiet at night. Overall, the spacious suite for excellent for our family and the price was decent. Loved to proximity to everything. Noise was a real concern. We stayed as hotels guests, not on timeshare. I was told that in the future they may only be renting to timeshare owners, not as a general hotel. Oh, by the way take a duck tour while in Boston, it was amazing !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: Fabfalco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice in a great location very close to the aquarium and Faneuil Hall and it's shops. My only complaint was the noise at night with workers below on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: jamjarMalta
Reviews.Content: The standards you expect ofmvci plus more. Everyone so helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. Just needed a change in the weather..snow in october!

Reviews.Title: “One of Boston's Best Properties”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaVisitor111
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week and it passed by very quickly. Great location near everything downtown. Wonderful large suite rooms with a kitchette. Great views and nice professional staff made our stay memorable. Only regret is not being able to stay longer. I did not know there was a pool or restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Smack dab in the middle of things”
Reviews.Author: divegirl2
Reviews.Content: This wonderful historic government building turned suite hotel, located next to Quincy Market, Faneuil Hall and The 'Aquarium' Subway stop couldn't be more perfectly located. Easy walk to North End, Long wharf area and all that they offer. Rooms are nice, property is secure and they serve fresh baked cookies in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Building, Rooms Need A Little Work”
Reviews.Author: ITravelandEat
Reviews.Content: Now folks, this is about as honest a review as you'll get. Why? Because as a time-share owner at Custom House, I have every reason to hype the place to the sky, but I'm going to be a bit critical too. You'll see. The historic building is an outstanding spot for a hotel, and Marriott did a great job with the conversion. In particular, the lobby routunda is stunning. The location is perfect. You are 50 feet away from a T station, two stops from the airport -- and within walking distance of everything, especially now that the Big Dig is complete. Because it's a time share building with hotel accommodations being something of an afterthought, it's best described as a limited service place. There's no restaurant, room service, or business center. There's no swimming pool, This is fine by me, if for no other reason than it tends to keep families with noisy little kids out of there. Hence, the Custom House tends strongly toward an adults-only atmosphere, thank God. And you won't want to have a car; there's no parking nearby, and even approaching it in a vehicle is tough. Let your cab driver, or the T, do that work. Also, you're one block from Quiicy Market/Faneuil Hall, and a short walk to all kinds of good restaurants, so not having a restaurant on the premises isn't any kind of tragedy. I know Boston very well, having lived there for more than a decade, and really don't think there's a better location for a tourist than this one. If yiou can get an upper floor room, the views are great. Either way, you'll want to go up to the observation deck to take in the view. Wow! Now, for the downsides. If they put you on a lower floor over the weekend, you'll hear the drunken revelers at the Irish pub. Bring earplugs and patience. During the week, it won't be a problem,.The room decor is shiny on the surface, but on closer inspection the furniture is on the cheaper side. The housekeeping could be a bit better, too. Nothing's crawling, but the place is starting to show wear and tear, and could use a renovation. Your "kitchen" consists of a sink, a small microwave, a small fridge, and some glasses and plates. You're not going to be cooking any meals at the Custom House, trust me. But I believe all the rooms are one-bedroom suites -- it's all I've ever had there -- and they're roomy, with a sleeper sofa in the living room. All in all, it's a fine place to stay, with a wart or two if you look closely. But that's true of just about anywhere I've ever stayed, so I have no hesitation giving this place a strong rating. It's not for everyone, but if you're an adult tourist with some sophistication, a feel for the big city, and a budget to match, In think you'll like this place quite a bit. I do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suites, Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: Robert N
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Custom House is in the historic Custom House tower and is perfectly located for easy access to the Boston Harbor ferry system, Faneuil Hall and the North End. We were early upon arrival and our room was not ready, so we left our luggage with the bellman and went out walking one of the great cities of America where my ancestors were Minutemen. After a couple of hours we came back and were shown to our suite--called villas in this hotel--and were very happy with what we found: a two-room suite nicely appointed, clean and large. We had a kitchen/sitting area that lead to the bedroom, which had a comfortable bed; one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept in. My wife and I went up to the observation deck, which affords outstanding views of Boston Harbor. Don't miss this. I turned in a small amount of clothes for cleaning and, when I did not find it back in our room when expected, I called the front desk and it appeared within two minutes. Pricey? Yes, but for this quality of stay in Boston in late spring (I had to check November 2010 because the system does not offer June 2010), especially given the hotel's location and the fact that it was a suite (about $300/night), it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Rental”
Reviews.Author: Raymond H
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was is an excellent property and great location. The staff was great and the apartments were well appointed. Be sure to take the "Super Tours" two day tour of Boston and Cambridge. We are not normally not tour coach travelers but these Trolleys, the drivers who narrate the tour and the whole experiencve was excellent. Union Oyster House ( oldest continuing operating restaurant in the USA ) is a must for lunch. Mama Marias Italian in the North end was great. Abe and Louie's is a true "Boston" steakhouse experience. Todd English's King Fish (right out your door) is excellent. You nust eat Leagal Seafood Long Wharf ... just excellent. Go to Rockport, MA for a day trip. In Concord, MA have Sunday brunch at the Colonial Inn. You will love Marriltts Custom House!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Quincypj
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently spent a weekend at the Custom House. It was fantastic! We arrived from Logan Airport by cab which cost $15. You really donâ€™t need a car when you are here but if you do parking at the custom house is expensive at $40 a day. If you don't want to take a cab the Custom House is located right near the aquarium subway stop on the blue line which you can reach from the airport. We stayed on the 18th floor and had awesome views of the city and the harbor. There was some noise from the bars and restaurants nearby on Saturday night but Sunday night was quite. We had a King bed and the kids slept on the sofa bed in the living room. We had a small fridge and sink but no microwave. There is a small convenience store right across the street where we bought fruit and yogurt for breakfasts. You couldnâ€™t ask for a better location. It is in the middle of everything, right next to Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall and 1 block from the Aquarium and Harbor boat tours. You can pick up the freedom trail right nearby and it is within walking distance of Bostonâ€™s north end, home of fantastic Italian restaurants! We ate at Giacomoâ€™s which was great and I will review that separately. We are Marriott timeshare owners on the points program. The Custom House is smaller than other Marriott properties so if you are staying there using points you should really try to book ahead. We were set to stay somewhere else when I called to give it one more try about 1 week before our stay and got lucky and got a room. The front desk staff was very helpful and we will definitely stay here next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Custom House”
Reviews.Author: nlkYorbaLinda
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Marriott Custom House in Boston. We've stayed at Marriott properties all over, but I do LOVE this place. In the middle of everything, beautiful, very nice quaint rooms. Staff was very helpful. We were able to see Boston on foot, by trolley and then eventually, rented a car to drive to surrounding areas and New Hampshire. Excellent food all over the city...I would love to go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In Boston”
Reviews.Author: MonaAnaheim_CA
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel/timeshare complex in the old US Customs House within walking distance of nearly every major historical attraction in Boston. The condo units are spacious; however, this is an old buidling, and we were somewhat surprised to have plaster falling on us one morning. The building maintenance staff got right on that. The view from the tower is fantastic. The Reception staff are some of the best I have ever seen anywhere. This hotel is withing walking distance of city tour offices that go to Cambridge, Lexington and Concord. We were able to walk back and forth to the North End restaurants with ease. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: bdhirst1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights when went to Boston for an anniversery celebration. Interesting and historic building with observation deck. Room was on the eighteenth floor with views north and west. In addition to the view, this was a two room suite that includes a kitchenette, dining table, couch and two TV's. Friendly staff. Easy walks to the North End and right across the street from Quincy Market. Only downside is that guests have to pay for the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific historic property & location”
Reviews.Author: miker163
Reviews.Content: We are big Marriott supporters and were looking forward to a week at this landmark facility. The location is only 1 block from the warf and next to Quincy Market. Can't be beat! The property and history are outstanding indeed. While some aspects are to be expected in a historic old building, ie: narrow doors, lower ceilings, limited ammenities, etc, the location and history are well worth it. If you are comming to swim or have a full kitchen...pass---this is not it. If you know Boston, you walk everywhere....a block to the harbour/aquarium/etc. Around the corner to Quincy Market and a 'pedal cab' or walk to the North End. They will even arrange for a rental car to go to the Cape or Provencetown. When we return...we can't think of a reason to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Boston at it's best”
Reviews.Author: cmv9298
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at this beautiful hotel this summer. There is nothing lacking here. Gorgeous rooms, wonderful staff and THE LOCATION! You are steps away from everything. I could not believe how pretty the Rose Kennedy Greenway turned out to be. Discovered the food trucks for lunch! LOVED it so much, we stayed there three different times!

Reviews.Title: “Custom House in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Kaasi49
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place with great views! We loved it! It is centrally located to all parts of the city and the concierge was wonderful in her recommendations for places to eat...Loved Little Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Boston in the Summer”
Reviews.Author: DonnaEric
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Custom House is a great property for seeing the sites of Boston. The property is in the long wharf area and is a short walking distance to Quincy Market, the North End, the Aquarium, IMAX, and wonderful eating establishment. The property does not have a full kitchen (only a microwave and a small refrig, so be prepared to eat out alot. Nice adequate gym area and a spectacular view from the observation deck. The Custom House is ideal for a couples get away.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Last_travel_bug
Reviews.Content: Booking it is difficult unless you are a Marriott Vacation Club member. Parking is very expensive. Very comfortable beds - all suites and it is very cosy. Location is excellent - right in the heart of the old city. Vehicle rental is not necessary as everything is within the Metro. For access to further areas, recommend to rent vehicle just for the day to avoid overnight parking charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families. Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: BethA114
Reviews.Content: My very generous sister decided to take me, my husband and our daughter to Boston to celebrate our daughter's 2nd birthday. She found this hotel when she was looking through hotel options in Boston. She had stayed in the Long Wharf previously and had initially considered booking that hotel for this trip, but decided to go with the Custom House when she stumbled upon it. The price for our one bedroom suite at the Custom House was the same as for a standard double room at the Long Wharf. We loved the room because it had a nice entryway followed by a good sized living area with sofa, armchair, side table and coffee table. Next to the living area was a small dining area with dining table for four, mini fridge, microwave, sink, and cabinets stocked with dishes, glasses, silveware, etc. Beyond that was a breezeway leading to the bathroom followed by the master bedroom with king bed, built-in closet/drawers and tv. This room was large enough for my husband and I to comfortably share with our two year old. My sister slept on the pull out couch in the living room. Valet parking was easy and the hotel is centrally (for us) located. Just steps to Faneuil Hall. A short walk to the aquarium and wharf area. Also a short walk to the T line we needed to get out to the Sam Adams brewery. Although somewhat longer, we were also easily able to walk over to the Boston Common area to visit the park/gardens. The hotel was very clean and the staff were gracious and accommodating. When we arrived and realized we had forgotten a sheet for our daughter's pack and play, the sent an children's bedding set up to our room. When our daugther decided that she no longer wished to sleep in the pack and play, they quite gladly delivered a roll away bed to our room, which fit in the master bedroom with plenty of room to spare. It was not a typical cot, but an actual matress on a platform with wheels and came to us fully made up. It was low enough to the ground that we didn't have to worry about our daughter hurting herself if she fell out during the night (which she thankfully didn't). The concierge helped us to find and book brunch on Sunday before leave. She convinced us that the brunch cruise on the Odyssey wouldn't be too stuffy for our daughter and she was right. She even made sure that they knew we were celebrating our daughter's 2nd birthday and put together a small gift back for her on our last evening, as well. The hotel does charge for their continental breakfast, but we never made us of it and simply had fruit and breakfast bars in our room. The fridge was handy for storing milk, fruit and snacks for our daughter. There is no pool, but we were so busy doing other things in Boston that we didn't really notice. Because the hotel is run as a vacation resort, they do have daily activities that you can participate in, although our daughter was too young for most of them as they were geared at 4 and up. We did enjoy the wine/cheese hour that they appear to host on Friday evenings and made good use of the dvd collection that they have an allow you to borrow for in-room use. If you're staying for more than a few days or with children, we would all definitely recommend the Custom House. Although they do have advertisements for the Marriott Vacation Club program, they were unobtrusive and we were never bothered by anyone approaching us and asking us to attend a sales seminar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Personal N
Reviews.Content: As a first time user of my time share points, the Marriott Custom House was truly an amazing stay. The room was a fairly good size, well laid out, although it could have used a better cooking facility & personally I would have preferred a full fridge rather than the mini fridge. The bedroom was luxurious & comfortable while the washroom was large & stocked with all amenities. The only negative about the room is the blinds allowing way too much light into the room in the morning. There are some recreational facilties here, but for swimming you have to go 2 blocks to the Marriott Long Wharf which is fine in the summer, but I wouldn't want to have to do that in the winter. Some great views from the outside observation area were welcome & the staff were all extremely helpful. They offer a continental style breakfast in the bar area, but I would recommend you avoid it, as it is overpriced poor quality foods & go to a local coffee shop or restaurant like we did.

Reviews.Title: “great employees”
Reviews.Author: gratefulLakewood
Reviews.Content: I would like to give high marks to the Custom House. We just arrived home and had a wonderful stay. The employees at the Custom House really made our stay in Boston a memorable one. Ellen the concierge was so helpful and informative and went out of her way to make sure our stay was memorable. Luccas in the North End had awesome food. Sergia who works in housekeeping was so sweet and helpful. She had a great attitude and smile. The Marriott should be proud to have her as a employee. The hotel is in a wonderful location but the noise can be loud from the local bars. I appreciated the free Starbucks in the morning and the free washer and dryer. I look forward to our next stay in this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our fifth stay.....always a great place.”
Reviews.Author: Optoko
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very clean and comfortable during our week's stay. The Custom House is very centrally located in Boston, a block from Quincy Market and Franeuil Hall, and subway (Metro T). Staff was courteous and helpful. Washer and dryers are available at no additional charge. Free wi-fi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic historic structure with best location in Boston for vacationers!”
Reviews.Author: bherrmann72
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston for vacation with my 8 yr old son during the heart of summer. Historic facility in a city in which your surrounded by history! Subway is right outside your door! Faniel Hall right next door! New Kennedy Greenway and Harbor right out the front door! Use the pool at the Marriott Long Wharf, visit the observation deck, gameroom, movie room, and bfast room! This rare "urban" Vacation Club also functions as a Hotel, and is a winner. I only wish Marriott would build more "in city" Vacation Clubs!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suites and a superb location”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravels2
Reviews.Content: My wife, my teenaged daughter and I stayed three nights at this downtown Boston hotel over the fourth of July weekend. We were very impressed with our one-bedroom suite which was equipped with a kitchenette and sofabed in the living room. My daughter found the sofabed somewhat uncomfortable but that was quickly remedied by the delivery of a mattress topper. The king-sized bed in the separate bedroom was exceptionally comfortable. The photos on Marriott's website faithfully represented the quality of our suite's furnishings as well as its roominess. The public spaces have been beautifully restored and the character of this historic building has been maintained in the guest rooms. Even though it was reportedly fully occupied for the weekend, we never found the property noisy or the lobby crowded. Front desk staff and the concierge were pleasant, helpful and eager to provide recommendations to local restaurants and attractions when asked. Despite the number of guests staying at the hotel that weekend, we never had to wait very long for our car to be retrieved by the courteous valet service. We were especially pleased with the hotel's central location; within steps of Faneuil Hall, the old State House, the Aquarium, etc. In fact, the entrance to the Aquarium subway station is beside the hotel. With so many attractions nearby, we did not have enough time to take advantage of all the amenities this hotel has to offer. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Custom House on our next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location in an unusual setting”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan6
Reviews.Content: I wasn't a big fan of the historic portrayals and the afternoon tea, etc, but the location adjacent to Fanueil Hall is fantastic, and the suites are large and very comfortable. Two rooms, full amenities, plenty of room to spread out, great beds. Excellent hotel for those with a full reimbursement coming from their company or a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghHolidayfan
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Custom House in Boston. Initially we were a bit worried about whether there was enough space for 2 adults and 2 kids but as there is so much to do in Boston, we spent very little time in our rooms. When we did we just watched movies or slept so we had more than enough space. The staff were really nice and helpful - we had many good recommendations for restaurants or shops from reception staff. The location is fantastic - very close to Quincy Market which has great shops, and near the harbour which has so many great restaurants as well as great views and tours. If you visit the Custom House, it's worth going up the top floor for a view of the city - beautiful. There are also laundry facilities up on (I think) the 24th floor and a games room which we made use of. Just a warning that if you take or hire a car, there is a 39 dollar charge per night for valet parking - and the car sat right outside the front door! Overall though we had a great stay and we would definitely go back or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ProfandMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights (July 23-25, 2011) and just loved the place. It was large enough for two adults and our three kids. The king bed in the bedroom was really comfortable. This place offers more privacy than a typical hotel room because of the hallway (with doors at each end) separating the bedroom and living room area. The kitchen is not a full kitchen, but it was great for our purposes. My kids loved buying breakfast foods and then eating in the room. We also had dessert which we bought in the North End and ate back at the room later. Others have mentioned the location, and I can't stress enough how perfect this place is situated. We could get pretty much anywhere in Boston in just a few minutes. Also, the view from our room was magnificent. Noise was not an issue for us, and we were there on a Saturday night. In fact, we almost stayed at the Marriott Long Wharf across the street because I was so worried about noise--but I am so glad we stayed at the Custom House instead. We were on the 17th floor and could hear some but not a lot of street noise. Another plus about this place is there are free laundry facilities for guests. You have to buy your own detergent, but the washer and dryer are free. I never had to wait for a machine either. I want to also say that the historic qualities of the building help to make this a special Boston experience. My kids also loved that we could see our hotel from other parts of the city. If we return to Boston, I certainly hope to be able to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dnrme
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here the second week of June 2011 and we had a wonderful stay. Yes...I did note the other reviews about the noise before deciding on our 10 day reservation, but decided the location was worth the possible noise-and I was right! Let me break down my review into various aspects regarding the hotel: ROOM: Our room was on the 7th floor. We had a wonderful view and I absolutely LOVED the lay out (worked perfect for a family of four). The master bedroom (wonderfully comfortable bed!) was seperated from the living area (queen pull-out sofa bed) by a small hallway with a door at each end (master bedroom/living area) and a large bathroom. It was nice having the bathroom in the middle of the rooms with doors to block off each room to decrease any noise. The living area was large enough to accommodate a rollaway bed for my teenage son, along with the sofabed for my teenage daughter. There was still room to navigate to the utility kitchen area to access the refrigerator which contained all our left-overs and snacks. The utility kitchen contained a sink, microwave, small refrigerator and all the plates/utensils you would need. The room was clean and spacious. There are two TVs (master and living area), several club chairs, and large window sills to accommodate all the papers/tickets/magazines you will acquire while on your trip! NOISE: Yes...there was noise. Like many of the other reviewers, our room faced State St. and the pubs and the shopping complex(Faneuil Hall). You could hear muffled yelling, cheering, laughing, and car noise. We were also there during the Stanley Cup playoff win and for the home-town parade...so the streets/pubs were full of party-ers. I thought the noise would bother me, so I came prepared with earplugs. I never needed them. Our days were so full each day with tons of walking and activites that come nightime (and with the time change), we were exhausted and I can say that I have never slept so good on vacation! Yes (again), there is noise...you are downtown...but if you live in ANY city or rural neighborhood..you know you hear the community around you. I would not NOT stay here because of the noise...the positives so outweigh the negatives! LOCATION: You could not ask for a better location! A subway stop (3 stops from the airport-you DO NOT need a car!) right outside the hotel, wonderful restaurants 1 block away, the North End a 5 minute walk (or less), the waterfront (walking paths, aquarium, farmer's market, wharf, food etc..) 1 block away, Boston Commons, Beacon Hill, theater district and more ALL within walking distance...not to mention the Freedom Trail is literally 2 blocks from the hotel! You cannot beat the location of this hotel. AMMENITIES: Okay..the hotel does not have a pool and that was a concern of ours when deciding to stay here, but given the fact that you have access to the Marriot Wharf's pool only a block away, we decided that the Custom House would be a better choice between the two hotels and we were not wrong. If you are deciding between the two hotels...the Custom House wins hands down! We did walk over and use the other hotels' pool (once). It's an indoor pool and kind of on the small side (the room smells heavily of chlorine) and it just wasn't appealing to my two teenage kids. On a side note, the other hotel is not as welcoming either. Anyway, back to the Custom House....the lobby is historically beautiful (a treat in and of itself), there is a wonderful observation (360 degrees) deck on the roof that provides one of the best views of the whole city, there is a small private movie theater for guests use (our kids watched Pirates and had the room all to themselves w/popcorn and all!) where they will put in any movie/dvd you want, there is also a game room/playarea for the smaller kids as well, the breakfast area is well equipped and has a good selection of continental breakfast items (the very nice Portuguese lady who was working there even boiled my kids some eggs in the microwave!), there is no room-service but we didn't miss it at all! Overall, a wonderful experience. Boston is a marvelous city and the Custom House is a great place to stay. If anyone would like more info or suggestions on activities etc...I would be happy to answer any questions via email (pljjnsr@aol.com).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItsATrip5
Reviews.Content: I was interested in this hotel originally because as a family of 5, city hotel rooms are too small to share and too expensive to pay for two rooms. I booked after reading the negative reviews and we are so happy that we did. The staff is wonderful, so friendly and accommodating. The location can't be beat and the building itself is gorgeous! It is visible from all over the city which the kids loved and was helpful for us too. The rooms were big and nicely appointed. The kids game room and play room were awesome. The observation deck is amazing and there were books to walk around the tower with that pointed out what you were looking at. Being in a historic building in such a historic city was really special. To address the negative comments, yes, it was loud late at night because of the bar scene. We were on the 8th floor (802) and it was loud after 12am. However, if noise is a problem, pack your earplugs. Most city hotels are noisy. The carpet in the elevator and room was due for a change, but not dirty, just worn. I am a snob about hotel cleanliness and the sheets, bathrooms, couches all passed my test. A-la-carte breakfast items are great and there is also a Dunkin Donuts next door. I would not think of staying anywhere else with the family in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Norie
Reviews.Content: The view was awesome! The rooms were good sized. It's an all suite hotel with one bedroom, a living room with a pullout, and a kitchenette. Steps from shopping and restaurants and Quincy Market. Short walk to the subway and harbor. One bonus was the mini-concerts/shows at night. After dinner, we would sit and relax with one free complimantary drink. Conveniently located. We walked everywhere (historical district) and when we got tired, walking back to the hotel was easy enough. The subway was also right across the street. There's a convenient store close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jdb01
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortably furnished. The kitchen area was small and as long as you were only microwaving food, it was perfect. There is a nicely outfitted workout room with modern equipment, game room for some laid back down time and a kiddie area. There were performers in the hotel Sunday - Thursday and a wine and cheese get-together Friday night. Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and willing to do whatever needed to be done to help us. Everybody had wonderful suggestions on where to go and how to get there. Our personal bellman was Rodney, who deserves a shout out for the great service and advice he offered. Apparently not everybody gets a personalized bellman. The Quincy Market was 100 steps from the building and there is plenty there to eat a reasonable prices. Quite a few fast food type places, several sit down places and at least 2 bakeries. As long as you don't stare blankly, everybody was eager to answer questions and get you your food quickly. At the market there were several street performers who worked the crowd for tips. Including a statue who would move after tipped. I watched one from a restaurant who did not moved for over 15 minutes. I was really impressed until I remembered that my brother in law hadn't moved from the couch in 2 years. It seems every place my wife and I wanted to see was either, less than 10 minute walk from here or a short subway ride. The subway entrance is on the corner, right next to the 24 hour quicky mart. I had no idea how small the city center is. Every place was close. The subway to and from the airport cost use $4.00 and was as fast as the taxi, which cost $24.00. Again thanks Rodney. I woould advise would to buy the BostonGO card if you are a serious sight-seer. We saved over $150 over the cost of a card. We also pooped out after 5 days. Boston will keep you hopping if you want. Do the whales and the freedom trail, our 2 favorite activities.

Reviews.Title: “Boston in July”
Reviews.Author: 6PATH
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near Fanuiel Hall and Boston Aquarium and Boston's North End restaurants. Great views of Boston Harbor and surrounding area. Short walk to fabulous restaurants with reasonable prices. T stop outside front door making for easy travel throuhout the city.Entertainment two different nights we were there for only three nights but will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pecanman2
Reviews.Content: We spent the 4th of July week at the Custom House. You cannot beat the location for downtown Boston sightseeing. Convenient to all transportation and hundreds of restaurants and bars. Noise was not a problem. We spent one night on 2nd floor and balance of stay on the 10th. Only complaint is getting to the ice machine. From 10 you have to go to 19, change elevators then to 24 for the only Ice machine in the building. Serious design flaw! Great staff and very clean villa.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Exactly what I expected”
Reviews.Author: JBadgers1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in July, after reserving a room back in February. Check-in was no problem, the clerk said she'd noticed we'd requested a high room on our reservation and so she'd "just" moved us from the second floor to the fifth floor (no other rooms available). We were in 505, a typical suite type room with separate king bedroom. We used the sofa bed and a rollaway for the two teens. Comfortable king bed. While it was a bit tight with the rollaway, just the option to be able to get a rollaway was great. Having the extra space for the kids with their own tv, and the refrig and microwave was great, and a real value, I think, compared to other hotels I researched. Our view looked south towards the office buildings and a bar. Not a great view, but okay. Nice tall windows! As other reviewers have said, the observation deck is spectacular. You can bring a drink up there and pretend it's the view from your room :) Also, as it's been said, it was noticably louder outside on Fri and Sat night compared to Thurs. We'd brought a travel sound machine to drown out the noise which helped us at least in the bedroom. The room seemed clean, but I did notice my white socks were noticably dirty after only an hour or so in there during the evening. We didn't spend much time in the room, typically leaving before 10 and getting back at 3 or 4 to regroup, before going out again. That's why when housekeeping tapped on our door to clean it five minutes after we'd just gotten back late one afternoon, it was a bit annoying and required some negotiation to have time to get ready and still allow the maid in there to get the room cleaned before she went home. We did not use the breakfast or the bar area in the eve. We'd brought along some breakfast items and bought some milk and other items at the 7 11 nearby. All in all, Boston was great and the hotel was perfect for us and (best of all) exactly what I'd expected, given the reviews I'd read on tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Melroseman2003
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Custom House on a timeshare exchange. The place is just very special; the architecture, history and location make it near perfect. Short walk to the Harbor and Long Wharf, Quincy Market, North End, Boston Commons...wherever. The view from the observation deck is awesome. It's a small timeshare place, so no real restaurant or other amenities (continental breakfast in the mornings and a bar in the evening), but I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Fredonian
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Custom House at least twice a year for years now and always very much look forward to returning. The entire staff is genuinely outstanding in their service--caring, prompt, friendly, knowledgeable. The rooms ("villas") are large and quite comfortable. There is a living room (couch, comfortable arm chair and coffee table) along with a small kitchen area (small sink, glasses, dishes, microwave oven, small refrigerator, but no stove) and a dining room table that comfortably sits four. That room has ample storage space and a large screen TV. The couch converts into a bed for two. There's a master bedroom with a king-sized bed, excellent storage and another large screen TV. There is one bathroom, but each villa has doors so that there's privacy in reaching the bathroom for those in the master bedroom and for anyone sleeping in the living room/dining room. The location is outstanding. The Custom House is easy to reach. It's only a few steps away from the Fanueil Hall/Quincy Marketplace and a half block away from the Greenway. It's a few steps away from the entrance to the MBTA Aquarium stop on the Blue Line and within easy walking distance of the North End (just across the Greenway) and much of downtown Boston. The Custom House offers free coffee throughout the day and has an exceptional entertainment program on many nights in its historic Counting Room. It also offers tours of the historic and iconic building and has some of the best views in the city from its observation deck (and from many of its rooms). As one would expect from a city location, there is valet parking and it's not free. The kitchen area is smallish and limited, but there are many excellent restaurants (as well as any number of fast food places) within a few steps. Continental breakfast items are available in the Counting Room during the morning. There is no pool, but it is possible to swim at the nearby Marriott Long Wharf (just across the Greenway).

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: nothistime
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for our family of 4 (2 teens) for a week in Boston. Suites were comfortably roomy and really decorated lovely. Service was great from the front desk staff and all our special requests were met swiftly and politely. GREAT location, a block from the wharf, and Fanueil Hall marketplace. Only a few blocks from the North End. And the Custom House itself was a beauty of a building--we went up to the observation floor at least once a day. We slept with the windows open enjoying the night breeze but there are a few pubs down below and loud people woke me up sometimes. This may be my only complaint but I would still go back there. I think this must be a secret or something because people didn't know that big clock-tower was a hotel. It's different. I highly recommend the Custom House.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay. Let Me Give You a Few Tips...”
Reviews.Author: Humres32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Custom House over Memorial Day weekend with our 2 nieces. First of all, it's a great location and a very beautiful hotel. You really can't beat it. It was great that no matter where we were, we could look into the skyline and say "There's our hotel". The architecture inside and out was amazing. I booked our room via Expedia and asked for a room on an upper floor given what I had read from others regarding the noise from the local bars. The hotel accommodated my request (thank you!) I would HIGHLY recommend you do the same. There are 2 bars that are across the street from the hotel and they can get loud. We stayed in room 2301 (highest level of rooms) and we had no issues with noise. Our room was small, but it was nice to have a bedroom for myself and my husband while the girls had the living room as their own area. The bathroom was also small, but for a few days we made due. The view from our room was amazing! There is an observation deck on the 25th floor -- very cool!!! Also, there is a game room on the 24th floor. Nice touch. We only played a few quick games of air hockey, but this was fun and not something we really expected. There is a small fridge in the room...we filled it with water which was helpful as the bottled water offered by the hotel was $5/bottle (yikes!) Also, we brought granola bars for breakfast. There is a breakfast room with free coffee/tea/hot chocolate. The food is expensive ($2 for a yogurt, $2 for a small individual serving of cereal, etc.) It's nice they have this as an option, but we only chose to go there one morning. My only complaints....the carpets in our room needed cleaning badly! Can't tell this just by looking at the carpet since it is dark blue. I know this because everyday my socks were BLACK! And this was before I left the hotel for the day. Also, one day housekeeping did not come until 4pm. By then we were back in our room to take a quick nap before dinner & the Blue Man group (which I would recommend....especially if you have kids!) Those are my only 2 complaints. I would highly recommend the Custom House and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bluebarry4
Reviews.Content: Great location next to harbor and Quincy Market. Nice rooms, great service. Beautiful hotel. Wouldn't Stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place for kids and grownups alike!”
Reviews.Author: MissesBoston
Reviews.Content: The Custom House is the best location for exploring the city and the view is breathtaking. My daughter didn't want to leave our room since she could sit in a window nook overlooking the harbor and read. Then we showed her the upstairs play room and she was over the moon. The concierge was wonderful at helping me, a former Boston resident but before I had children, find places that would be best for a family. We explored, we swam (you walk across the street to the Long Wharf - honestly not a biggie), she directed air traffic into Logan from the observation level, and we never had to go the same restaurant twice given how much is around there! Not your typical hotel - but honestly, a great fit for Boston and the staff was so genuinely nice to my daughter that many knew her name instantly despite a relatively short stay. This is Boston. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “What an AMAZING City!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lv2travelphx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mattiott Custom House the second week of March and we had an amazing time. You can NOT beat the location and the peolple in BOston are SO nice. Normally we plan our vacation around a beach but this time we decided to change it up and I was glad we did. We were immediately impressed!! A few tips for any first time "big city" travelers; to save money....take the FREE shuttle from the airport to the subway and hop on the blue line to the aquarium exit and litterally the second you walk out the door you are facing the hotel (sure beats the $25 cab ride). As far as things to do...if you want to do A LOT purchase the GO BOSTON card ( we purchased ours from Costco online for $139/person and it was way worth it! We did the following and all were great with the exception on one; Aquarium, Boston Duck Tours, Fenway Tour, Harbor Tour, Sam Adams Tour, 2 day double decker bus access, Museum of fine arts, Science Center (all included with the Go Boston Card) The only disappointment was the Science Center ( people were rude and I was not impressed!!!). And for the best part....The Food!! You really can't go wrong no matter where you eat but we really enjoyed Bonavitos, Legal Seafood and Chart House. As far as the resort the people were very friendly and if you are a timeshare owner or there on exchange....don't miss the welcome drinks on friday evening ( Nick the host) he was Great!!! And saturday morning the head concierge shares some great tips about boston and introduces the subway system, Very Helpful!!! The last two days of our trip we rented a car and went to a B&B in Mystic CT (5 stars as well). Overall great trip!!!! One one down side on the resort is the beds...they are very firm. I asked if we could have our room changed but the guy at the front desk said that all the beds are on the firm side and he immediately offered to bring an extra feather bed cover we could sleep on. It helped and they seemed genuinely interested in finding a solution for me:). Love Boston and we will be back to stay at the Marriott Custom house.

Reviews.Title: “I must have stayed at a different Marriott Custom House.....the one with NO Pool”
Reviews.Author: MaineMan2Maine
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from my room, I only wish you could hear what I hear from this room. It's April 21,2011-12:15 am room 702 and sleep is not happening for awhile. The combination of people screaming, cars honking horns and the current drum solo by a panhandler banging on 5 gallon buckets is nothing short of a 3 ring circus. I actually went down to see what the noise was only to see the unfounded talent banging away. Front desk said they would send security,I asked what about the police, she replied they wouldn't move him. Security guard came out, took a look and said the police will move him....I just shook my head. Stayed out there for a half hour no cops....but he did stop. If you are staying here make sure your not in rooms that end in 01 and 02...be opposite the black rose. The room is spacious, bath needs some work. The have flat screen tv's but no digital....no excuse for that , it's 2011 for christs sake, lot of snow on the tvs. there is a breeze or should I say a gale coming from the windows.....note don't wear a hat. I searched trip advisor for hotels, I narrowed my search to hotels with swimming pools as my 7and 3 year old were with us. Saw the Marriott custom house had a pool according to trip advisor and was 1 of 30 that did. We just stayed at the marriott on Marco island so we figured why not. We get here and there is NO POOL!!! You can imagine the look on their faces. No room service, no bar.......the people that are handing out rave reviews of this place must be employees.. I have stayed in Boston more than I can count and this ranks next to last. For a hotel in the same location.....Boston Harbor is my choice. If you are booked here do yourself a favor........look somewhere else......you been warned.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I know”
Reviews.Author: Reisewarner
Reviews.Content: Having been in Marriotts many times this was a very pleasant surprise. Very nice suites, coulours, materials and textures well selected in the historic 25+ floors tower in central location. Actually this is part of the Marriott Vacation Club but could be booked as any other hotel. There are guided tours in the tower for guests, a viewing platform with perfect views to harbor, bay , airport in a distance and Boston. Even from the rooms you have very nice views to several directions as these suites have several rooms looking to two directions

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in boston”
Reviews.Author: benjam7847
Reviews.Content: The Aquarium subway stop is a few yards from the property and makes it convenient to get from the airport. No need for a cab or rental car. located near lots of restaurants and tourist attractions. My wife was in town for a conference at the convention center which is off the beaten path. The rooms are spacious and have flat screen tv's in the living and bedrooms. as a Marriott timeshare owner, this property is consistent with the high quality that we expect. The continental breakfasf is convenient and reasonably priced. i highly recommend this property. Friendly and courteous staff throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Best to book through Berkshire Concepts”
Reviews.Author: chas1954
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Marriott Custom House several times, starting back when it first opened. Each stay has been memorable, and we look forward to our next visit in November for thanksgiving. I personally like having the Irish Pub 'The Black Rose" close, especailly in winter. We went through a site, Berkshire Concepts and got this place for a week for $299, although we used only 4 nights, it ws still a steal. Everything is perfect at this property. It is a small distance to anywhere in town, and the area around the Custom House has grown, so there are a few places to eat within a block ( there isn't a restaurant on site) Overall you cannot miss!

Reviews.Title: “If your not staying here ask yourself why”
Reviews.Author: Tuckernuckman
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic!! Really. The building itself is awesome in the truest sense of the word, an old world castle if there ever was one. The location is as good as it gets in Boston and the decor is top class. I was looking for a home away from home for my trips to Boston with the kids. We wanted to be close to the aquarium and childrens museum and this place fit the bill perfectly. The suites are all identical corner units with huge windows and tall ceilings that will give my kids the consistency to consider this their "Boston house" as it will always seem the same to them no matter which suite we get. This gets them excited to visit without the anxiousness of going someplace foriegn. And excited to visit is just what they were when they saw the 20th floor activity center. Essentially the 20th floor is an indoor playground complete with a tree house type jungle gym, indoor play kitchen, coloring table, basket ball hoop, bowling ally game, train set, two huge doll houses and a childrens book library. And that is just the stuff I can remember playing with myself!! They really go out of their way to make kids feel welcome and my kids definitely appreciated it which is something I found quite unique considering how upscale the surroundings and decor was. The observation deck provides the best view of Boston available and although there is no indoor pool you get full use of the Marriott Long Wharfs indoor pool and facilities just for showing your key. And with the long wharf being only two blocks away it was an easy walk for even my 20 month old son. I personally felt that the custom house building and decor were far superior to the long wharfs and quite a bit more upscale. I'd also like to note that because the custom house is a smaller facility than the long wharf, there is a lot less "busyness" and as a result of this I think that the staff has the opportunity to offer a better level of service. As for the Custom house staff, there isn't enough room in this review to describe how great they were. From the concierge to the chambermaids I found nothing but professionalism. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and always there when we needed them and the housekeeping people were more than happy to accomodate the extra needs of my toddlers for blankets, towels and cribs. But personally, the most important thing of all was the fact that it seemed to us that everyone at the custom house loved their job. I've never seen more genuine smiles from a hotel staff in my life. Everyone we met seemed to truly be happy to see us and made my family feel like we were part of their family; which is a remarkable thing for a place as upscale as this. The comments I've made above represent what I consider to be true value, and although I'm a firm believer in the phrase "You get what you pay for", in the case of the Marriott Custom House you are getting far more than what your paying for. -Tim from Nantucket.

Reviews.Title: “A plus experience and location”
Reviews.Author: islandmap
Reviews.Content: After researching dozens of hotel options in downtown Boston, we decided on the Custom House based on reviews on Tripadvisor. The location is perfect for those newbies to the city looking to experience everything from history to shopping to great food on Hanover Street. The front desk staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms were exceptional- high end decor and beautifully decorated. The 26th floor offers incredible views of the city- a must see! There is no restaurant or room service which is fine for us. The rooms have a small kitchen and coffee maker. Tons of restaurants are just out the front door. One recommendation: put your Do not Disturb sign out if you don't want maid service early in the morning. Traveling with teens that need the extra sleep don't respond well to that knock at the door. Despite what others indicate here, there is daily maid service. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful historic building that has to be seen”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloo1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from the Custom House in Boston and our opinion is as follows: 1. Beautifully decorated and comfortable rooms with loads of wardrobe space. 2. Extremely helpful front desk, porters and concierge. 3. Location simply marvellous with wonderful restaurants at your doorstep. 4. Shopping to die for ! if you have a car try to visit Wrentham outlet mall - terrific and no state tax in Boston ! 5. This is a simply wonderful Historic Building right in the heart of the city that Marriott must be very proud to have. 6. This is our second time here and we will, definitely, return. 7. Your towels are changed and your bins emptied every day at no extra charge. I have read a review where the person wasn't happy you have to push a button to open the main door ? firstly, it can be freezing in Boston and this is an automatic closing door that can't be left open accidentally and, secondly, this is for security as if you are out after 9pm you have a pass card to use, if not you shouldn't be entering without first speaking to the valet. On the 1st floor Continental breakfast is served between 7-10am weekdays and 7-11 weekends. This breakfast is more than adequate and has just about everything you could possibly want with free tea/coffee/hot chocolate. There is also a cocktail lounge open from 6pm onwards. Nearby, you have a variety of wonderful restaurants as well as Quincy Market. We walked the whole of the city and thoroughly enjoyed ourselved in Boston. Finally, you can if you have a car take a trip out to Cape Cod or Rhode Island which aren't too far away. Cape Cod is about 1hr and its best to have lunch at one of the restaurants down by the marina as they are lovely and have a view of the sea. Hope this helps, when I have loaded my photos onto the computer I will post one of the inside of the Custom House which will show the beauty of it.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC, Best week ever”
Reviews.Author: lisac52003
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing week in The Custom House, the staff were so friendly , extremely helpful + courtious. The accomodation was Fantastic, top points for all services. WE WILL DEFINATELY be back...oh ansd shopping great too

Reviews.Title: “Really cool”
Reviews.Author: MarkRives
Reviews.Content: We stayed here. Fantastic trip, great location, wonderful room. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family”
Reviews.Author: JasonWright_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family including three kids ages 2, 5, and 10. The front desk staff informed us upon check in that they have two kids play room areas on the upper floors. The play room areas were a wonderful place for the kids to get out some vacation energy between trips around town. The guest room was also great. Everything was well kept and clean. The location is superb with Fanueil Hall right across the street. The North End is within walking distance as well. My 2 year old rode the stroller but my 5 year old managed the walk just fine. The Boston Common is also not too far off. This was my fourth stay at this hotel and I will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “I'll defend this place a little”
Reviews.Author: turtlemeng
Reviews.Content: Today is my 3rd day and I have formed a much better picture of this place. I am a Marriott owner so I cannot rank "value" here because I just swapped a week of my timeshare. I read the poor review of someone from southern CA like me who apparently paid a lot, and I can understand. I got here Friday and had two sleepless nights thanks to the rowdy Irish bar crowds (even sirens). So, my recommendation #1, if you are staying here Fri or Sat--BRING EARPLUGS. I am not kidding. I am on the 9th floor and I could hear all the songs they were singing, and I usually sleep like a log. Now, after these nights, last night (Sunday) it was completely quiet, I rested well, and today happened to listen in on the history of this place. Being a historical landmark, they have lots of restrictions so I can now pardon why the bathroom is not so fancy, the windows cannot be made more soundproof, etc. It's fascinating how this building could be turned into a hotel in the first place. Try to join the tour crowds and you might appreciate the hotel more--they talk about how the elevators had to be put in, you get to see the clock mechanism on 24th floor (right in the laundry room). Of course it cannot be compared to my Newport timeshare with kitchen/jacuzzi size tub/laundry in my villa/much nicer and bigger kid's club....but it's understandable. It's also right next to the subway station so you don't have to walk a lot, esp when it's cold like today. The staff can probably be friendlier, but the concierge staff have been very nice. They also try to bring entertainers and give movies in the theatre every other day. No room service--as you can imagine. No nearby grocery--but all you've got is a microwave anyways. (The convenience store across the street is a joke). If you want fresh fruits and veggies either go to Whole foods (take the subway 3 stops to Bowdoin) or if you are here Sat AM go to Haymarket, the farmer's market is unbelievably cheap--cheaper than sunny California. Boston is TINY, you can easily walk to Legal Sea Foods, Sel de la Terre, both across the street. I am spending a whole week here with only a stupid microwave and still surviving, thanks also to the proximity of China Town.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1stSouthernBelle
