Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our stay in Boston, & then left on a Fall Foliage cruise from that port. We were very impressed with the location of this hotel/(time-share). We didn't know it was a timeshare when we booked, but it worked out well. My only complaint was, I had asked if they provided breakfast, (like most of the major chains) & was told yes...but since it was a timeshare, we didn't realize we had to PAY for what we ate & it was charged to our room. Having a 3-yr old w/us, it was wonderful to turn her loose in the large playroom. You can walk all over the tourist area, & we had NO problem finding our way back to the hotel, because it is has a tall clock tower in the upper part, & could easily be seen from blocks away. Enjoyed the kitchen area in our room, would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk Woman should retire!!!”
Reviews.Author: fmax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped by to see about booking a room on 9/23/10, at around 1:30pm and had such a bad experiance with the woman at the front desk, we will never be coming back. She was not only rude, but could care less about earning our stay. It was bad enough, that we stayed in the lobby to see if it was us, or if this is how she handled everyone. The next woman in line was looking for an extended stay of 40 nights. Her responce to her was " There's no one here to help you with that"! I figure that a $10,000-12,000 loss for the hotel. Someone at the hotel need to see that this woman is removed fast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Family with Young Children”
Reviews.Author: RitasSweets
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Marriott's Custom House in Boston. We traveled with our two-year old and it was so convenient having the small kitchen area to fix her snacks and meals. The location couldn't be better! Just steps from the Quincy Market and Aquarium. It was also great being so close to the Italian District. We loved this hotel and hope to stay there again soon! The staff was very friendly and the rooms were spacious and clean. Great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place - perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: MapTravelers
Reviews.Content: The first thing you have to know is that this Marriott is a timeshare so your expections should not be to receive hotel service in a timeshare. With that said, I would highly recommend the Custom House and would love to stay there again. The rooms are elegant and clean. The staff is very friendly and service oriented (I wouldn't expect less from a Marriott resort). All my preregistration requests were honored (early check-in and a high floor). Everyone would ask us how our day was going and give input on our next day's agenda. * Public transportation will leave you on the front steps of the hotel * It is literally across the street from the Quincy Market, wondrful restaurants, all the ferry's, trolly stops and other attractions * Every night the resort has some type of entertainment for he guests My husband and I loved our stay and hope to be lucky enough to be able to trade into the resort again.

Reviews.Title: “You Need To Read This Review”
Reviews.Author: rmccormick
Reviews.Content: I, like yourself read all of the reviews for Marriott's Custom House and have to tell you this was the first time I felt the reviews were waaaayyy offffff on Trip Advisor. I stayed there with my wife on Labor Day weekend, cost $300+ a night, and was very dissapointed. 1) For $300+ a night you'd think you'd be staying at a 5 start hotel with all of the ammenities and ambience that comes with it. When we got there we weren't greeted by a bell hop but by a door with an "push button to open" sign. The lobby was small, no restaurant, and no bar to catch a drink and relax. There was a bar on the 2nd or 3rd floor that was small, dull and far from anything that could be considered as fun. 2) You walk into your hotel room and large, but very dated. Instead of a modern bathroom we found a bathroom that belonged in more of a 3 star corporate hotel. This is also VERY IMPORTANT, Do NOT stay on a lower floor. We were on the 4th floor and I've never had a worse night of sleep. This hotel is right across the street from one of the most popular Irish Bars in the city. This place was loud until around 3am and not with the type of crowd you'd want to hang out with. More like the kind of crowd who would barf on your shoes. To add insult to injury our air conditioner was also not working right and sounded like a truck uping up its back gate around ever 10 minutes when it turned on. 3) This hotel was over priced. If you are paying over $200 a night I'd suggest you go to the W. That's where we went after our first night and found it to be a Much Better Stay.

Reviews.Title: “A sophisicated classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneKN_63
Reviews.Content: I'm a devoted Marriott customer, I'm never disappointed. This property is so beautiful and packed with history. The location is unbeatable, we took the blue line from the airport and were there very efficiently and landed right in front of the hotel. If I visit Boston again I wouldn't stay anywhere else. I was with my adult son and he wouldn't hear of taking the king bed and slept on the pull out. I wish there were an option of two beds rather than the king option only. We still loved it. The room wasn't ready as check in isn't 'till 4, tough if you have an early flight which we did. We took a whale watch trip to kill time, great fun, saw whales! Only problem, they should warn of rough water 26 miles out, there were lots of very seasick passengers. Not a problem for us, we're sailors. But at times it was pretty gross. Dinner at Hamersley's Bistro, absolutely fabulous and next to the BCA theater complex.

Reviews.Title: “In the thick of it”
Reviews.Author: Shardlake
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here and would recommend it apart from one small thing. Firstly the good points - right in the heart of it a stone's throw from Quincey Market and also the aquarium. We had tried to get a suite in the Marriott on the wharf but they were all booked up so we took the plunge and "upgraded" to the Custom House. We were not disappointed - the rooms were great with an ever so comfy bed. Our daughter slept in a travel cot in our room. We had a room that looked out over 2 sides which was nice. The sitting room was very comfortable although both my wife and I banged our heads on the low hanging chandelier over the dining table. I think it is a design fault as opposed to muppetry on our parts. The staff were really friendly and the bell boy even wheeled our luggage to the underground station when we left (all of 20 yards but a very nice touch nonetheless. It was dead easy getting out to the airport even with a rambunctious toddler and all our luggage. We had an evening flight and it was great that even after we checked out we could use the play area for our daughter. We basically had it to ourselves which was fantastic and it is rammed with toys. The downsides - a) the internet in the lobby was not free; okay that is a minor gripe but b) - you are really in the thick of it and the nosie at nights coming up from the bars and streets is really quie loud. For us it was not as off-putting as noise from neighbours (of which we did not hear any) but if you are seeking peace and quiet you may not get it on a Friday and Saturday night. I dont think it would deter us from staying again but it is a consideration if quiet is a priority for you. Still, it is a superb place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KingCharlesGM
Reviews.Content: This hotel/time share units was absolutely amazing! Not only did I love the guest rooms so elegantly furnished, the staff was wonderful as well! The location cannot be beat. Everything we wanted to do was all within a couple blocks. We took the train in from Philadelphia and used the T (and our feet!) for our entire weeks stay! Karen the Concierge did a super back of the house history tour of the Customs House on Monday morning that was so thrilling! What a great week in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: Beck_8
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights from Wed. 21st July. This is an excellent hotel, the rooms are as others have described-clean & comfortable. The location is also excellent, with subway stop outside that will take you straight to the airport. Every member of staff that we encountered throughout the place greeted us & were very pleasant & helpful. You need your keycard to operate the lift & need to get 2 different lifts to get to the Observation Deck-you will meet lots of other guests in the lifts because if you do not put your card in quick enough you can end up going up & down & visiting lots of other floors. We had requested a high room & got one on the 6th floor-this is not high enough if you are staying at a weekend. On our final night (Friday) we had screaming & shouting from the street until 2am & then at 7am a crane arrived outside to hoist an air-conditioning unit to the building opposite. I would highly recommend this hotel but if you are staying at a weekend get a room as high up as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: USAF-Retired-1996
Reviews.Content: We rented a week from an owner here. Had a great room on the 16th floor overlooking the harbor and Aquarium. We landed at Logan, took the shuttle bus to the MBTA Airport stop and bought 7 day unlimited ride passes for $15 each. Two stops on the inbound T and exit at the Aquarium stop. Go in the opposite direction of the Aquarium to exit on State Street at the hotel front entrance. We bought some essentials at the grocery store across the street and were ready to go. We had 2 day trips planned to Cape Cod and Portland Maine and rented a car from Enterprise at One Congress Street which is about a 4 block walk or you can take the T to the Haymarket stop and itâ€™s only half a block from there. To avoid the $38 a day parking fee at the hotel, I had made 2 one-day reservations with Enterprise but they consolidated it into one reservation and told me to park the car overnight in their garage and they validated my parking the next day. Great folks to deal with in that office. Marriottâ€™s Custom House is as everyone has described. We had an air conditioning malfunction and they moved us over night to another room until the HVAC technician could come the next day. Gave us chocolates and a bottle of champagne for our inconvenience. A week was not enough to see everything we wanted and we look forward to returning to the Custom House again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful View from a Beautiful Suite”
Reviews.Author: lbouchard33
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we were only able to spend one night at this beautiful property. We checked in on a Sunday and had requested an early check in, a high floor, and extra pillows.... ALL of which we received (that never happens to us)!!! I can't even describe how beautiful the view was from our room. We were on the 19th floor and fortunate enough to be in a corner room. We had a beautiful view of the harbor from our bedroom and a beautiful city view from the living room! The suite was tastefully decorated and the layout was great. You MUST go to the 26th floor and spend some time at the observatory! We spent quite a bit of time admiring the view and were lucky enough to watch the sunset over Boston. I believe that all of the suites are the same (except for the presidential suites on the upper floors) no matter which floor you're on. I would still be very happy with this hotel even if we got a suite on a lower level... however, this corner room on the 19th floor made this room EXCEPTIONAL and I'm so glad that we had the opportunity to get such a great room. Even though we were up that high, we still heard quite a bit of street noise. We did have our windows open a bit though. It was a Sunday night, so it wasn't too bad. When booking a room online, it was either this one or the Marriott Longwharf. The Marriott Longwharf room would have been $440 per night, this room at the Custom House was only $299 per night. The Longwharf is not a very tall building... and while you may get a harbor view, you wouldn't get a view of Boston. Without a doubt, we picked the very best hotel, in the very best location, with the very best view!! We were only steps from the fanueil hall(we watched street performers from our room), the aquarium, the Boston Harbor (where we experienced CODZILLA.... you must do this... it was so much fun!!). We really had no complaints. We could complain about the cost of parking... but it's the same no matter where you go in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, historic hotel...but”
Reviews.Author: Cincy2
Reviews.Content: Great location, but.... We stayed at the Custom House over a long weekend. It was an ideal set up for us as we were traveling w/our 19 yr. old son and wanted to have a suite arrangement in our hotel room. Our room, 401, was spacious. Son slept on the pullout couch and had his own TV. We had a King bedroom to ourselves. Plenty of closet space, large bathroom and a kitchenette. I did wish that the bathroom had more counter space for toiletries. The Custom House is a Marriott Vacation Club property whereby most of the rooms are reserved for those who own property in MVC. Other rooms (leftovers?) are able to be booked as a regular hotel. Iâ€™m not sure if the Vacation Club rooms differ from the hotel rooms. There were only 5 rooms on our floor. I had requested to have a room as high up as possible and was told that Vacation Club owners had priority (which is fair) so we ended up on the 4th floor. Total cost for 3 nights was $837. as we had some Marriott â€œbuckâ€�s. Good news: GREAT location. Right across the street from the Aquarium stop on the T (transit system). Near all the action, many restaurants and historical sights. Wonderful hotel staff. Historic building with awesome views from the observation deck floor. There is a store right across the street where you could purchase small food items, etc. Not so good news: Check in was disappointing. We had a morning flight and arrived at the hotel at 11:00 am. Understandably, our room was not available. We were asked for our cell phone # and were told that they would call us when the room was ready. Check-in is stated to be 4:00pm. Lobby was very crowded w/ guests and we had our luggage held. We returned to the hotel at 4:00 after a hot day of sightseeing and our room was still not ready. Finally at 4:45 we were given keys to our room. Apparently Fridays are a huge turnover day with Vacation Club guests. Without room keys you can not access the elevators, so until you check in you really canâ€™t do much at the hotel besides sit in the lobby. Also, there is no restaurant or lounge on site. There is a Vacation Club bar (The Counting Room) which is open some hours...again need the key. To be fair, the staff did apologize for the late access to our room. A small issue, but my husband likes to make coffee in the room in the morning. The packet of coffee was never replaced so on morning #2 and #3 he had to go without. NOISE! Be warned, if you are a light sleeper. Our room faced the Black Rose bar. On Friday night I could hear raucous laughter, etc. till the wee hours of the morning, but on Sat. night it was crazy. I felt as if our bed was right in the middle of every bachelorette group and frat boy partying hardy. Cars honking, motorcycles revving up, all kinds of shouting in the streets. The bars close at 2:30 am and at about 3:00 things finally quieted down. The Custom House is right on the edge of the Quincy Market bar action. When I complained a bit at the Front Desk on Sunday morning I was assured that the streets would be much quieter on Sunday night...and they were. In sum, I would recommend the Custom House for the easy location and if you desire a suite arrangement. If you are at all bothered by noise and plan a Sat. night stay, you may want to bring your earplugs! When I made our reservation I was hoping that a high up floor would help avoid the noise issue which I had read about in other reviews on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Nice roomy place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Fab44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Custom House for four nights over the Fourth of July weekend and couldn't have asked for better accommodations for the four of us(my husband and I and two We had a requested a higher floor because of past reviews which we didn't get but noise was not a problem at all. I'm not sure what people were hearing-we couldn't hear any street noise at all. The view is not quite the same as the higher floors but we were quite happy with the room. I had looked into many hotels but this one seemed to meet our needs of being near the Freedom Trail, Fanueil Hall and the Marketplace the best and it is a suite hotel. It was quite a bit more expensive than a room at comparable hotels but was well worth it. The room was actually two rooms with a large high ceiling living room/kitchenette and a good size bedroom with a very comfy king size bed. The bathroom was large and both rooms had flat screen TV's. The A/C worked great and was easy to control-we kept it on fan instead of auto and it didn't shut off and on and wake us up like it did in other hotels we have stayed at. My kids enjoyed relaxing in the room. My son slept on the sofa bed and we had requested a rollaway for my daughter which we got and it was just like a real twin size bed-very comfortable! The building itself is easy to see-just look up for the clock tower and that's the Custom House! Be sure to take the elevator to the top and see the view and history of the clock tower. The unique design of the building makes it impossible to have a pool so you'll need to go across the street to the Marriott Long Wharf if you want to swim. My kids didn't want to swim so we didn't go. The hotel was super easy to find. Take the Blue Line T(subway/train) from the airport and go two stops to the Aquarium stop. Exit out of the station the opposite exit as the aquarium and you pop up right across from the Custom House. The staff at the Custom House are friendly and go out of there way to help you with anything from directions to activities nearby. I wish we could have stayed longer! If we go back with kids, we'll be staying at the Custom House!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Impressive hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chezcalais
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the impressive Marriott Custom House. The Custom House is a centrally located historical building with a small museum inside of it. There is also access to the clock tower on one of the upper floors of the hotel, but you must be a guest to access that part of the building. There is also a secure exterior walk way on one of the upper floors where you can glimpse and photograph spectacular views of Boston. You can also see the peregrine falcons up close here as it is their home. The rooms themselves are gorgeous. They are suites with sitting rooms, a small dinette kitchen and ample bathrooms. You will have to valet your car. There is no parking lot, but the valet fee is acceptable when you compare it to parking in the nearby high-rise garages. If you can, try to stay here. It is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Getting from Logan Airport to Custom House”
Reviews.Author: TimSylvia2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Custom House the last week of May during Memorial Day weekend and had a wonderful time. Ellen, in concierge, went out of her way to arrange tours for us, and Justin at the front desk was great at helping us navigate the city and Cape Cod. When we arrived, we took a taxi from Logan Airport to Custom House which cost us $50 for 3 people. We later found out at our orientation meeting at Custom House, Boston's Massachusetts Transit ( their commuter train or Mass Trans ) runs from Logan to Custom House in 2 stops. At the airport, go to the taxi, bus, shuttle stand and take the free shuttle to the train line. At the train terminal, buy your tickets at a kiosk for $2.00 per person. Hop on the inbound train to Boston and get off at the the Aquarium stop. As you exit the train, walk toward the front of the train to get to Custom House. Proceed to the stairs leading to street level. The right set of stairs goes to Quincy Market, the left stairs goes to Custom House. No matter which exit you pop out at, you're only 1 block from the Custom House. Custom House is a landmark, just look up and you'll see the clock tower. Check operating hours for the Mass Transit, they run late, but not all nite.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Custom House - A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2010Travelers
Reviews.Content: We received impeccable custom service at Marriottâ€™s Custom House in Boston, MA. The front desk, concierge and housekeeping staffs were all very pleasant and most were willing to answer any questions we had. We stayed on the 18th floor in a corner unit overlooking the city and bay. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ckdnl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property this past weekend. We found the service very good and the rooms very spacious and clean. The hotel is in a fantastic location for touring Boston. The hotel offiered free wireless and had a nice fitness centre. Our only issue was the nighttime street level noise from the many local pubs in the area, for this reason I had to score sleep quality a 3/5. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable. Room had a separate...”
Reviews.Author: autumnsonata
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable. Room had a separate living area and tiny bathroom. Comfortable beds. We were on the 17th floor and the view was spectacular. Kitchen nook with basic necessities. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance and bars too. Loved the North End with all the great Italian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not all rooms created equal”
Reviews.Author: luvpalmtreesVirginia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in over 12 different hotels in Boston over the last 5 years. This time we were there for my daughter's graduation. The location is perfect for just about anything you could want to do in Boston. The hotel is located maybe 20 steps from a T station, half a block from Faneuil Hall, a block from the water and walking distance to TD northgarden. Out of all the places we have stayed this would probably be the top 1 or 2 for location. The room size is another reason to stay here. There is a separate bedroom and living room with a sofa bed- perfect for families. There is a small convenience store across the street or for more selection for a longer stay take the T to Shaws. Now for what bothered me and a reason why I wouldn't stay here again is how noisy some of the rooms are. I expressed my concerns about being on a low floor upon arrival (the hotel is located across the street from a couple bars). We were told our room on the first floor had soundproofing. It does but that doesn't help with car horns, people yelling and music from the bars. After the first (sleepless) night I asked a couple times if there were any rooms on a higher floor. We were told there was not. I asked if we could switch to the Marriott a block away and were told we couldn't. By 1 in the morning I was ready to pack up and go to another hotel. I tried once more at the front desk and miraculously a room appeared on the 9th floor- a gorgeous, quiet room. I think the hotel should offer the lower rooms at a slightly less price than the higher rooms. For some people noise isn't an issue and yet I would have gladly paid more for that quiet 9th floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay in the Hub”
Reviews.Author: BostonChik85
Reviews.Content: The Marriot Custom House is a wonderful place to stay. My parents own at the Custom House who rent out a few weeks out of the year just to come into Boston. They live about an hour of the city. I stayed here for the night back in February for a Girls Night Out. I got an owner's discount and it was extremely affordable for "Boston" Standards. The Custom House is in a prime location. The Blue Line is right outside the entrance. Fanueil Hall is right there. Fanueil Hall has some fun shops and restaurants. The resort is only a short walk over to the North End (Amazing Italian Food Places + Desserts). I recommend Mike's Pastry! Their Cannolis/Ricottas Cakes are delicious. As for the resort itself, the staff is also so gracious and accomodating. I requested a (cot) for my friends. They brought one up for us no problem. They usually have cookies or drinks in the lobby for when you check in. The villas are Suite Style/1 bedrooms with a Small Mini Kitchen. I recommend a higher up room because the nightlife can get pretty rowdy. There are tons of bars and restaurants within walking distance of the Resort. This Resort is more geared towards the touring the city. They do have some programs for kids but it's not the type of place to stay in for the day. If you want to use the pool, you'll have to go across the street to the "Marriot Long Wharf". The best rooms are the "L Shaped Rooms". When you come out of the elevators, they are on the last door on your left. If you can request a room before you come, I recommend that. If you have a later flight etc, you can leave your baggage with the front desk and they'll tag/lock it up for you. You can come back anytime to come grab it. Valet Parking is kinda of expensive, I believe it's $30 or $40 something a day. Public Transportation is a lot easier and cheaper to get around! You can purchase a Charlie Card for any domination and it will take you all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: OakSquareMayor
Reviews.Content: An executive summary- a fantastic building and staff that made for a great stay! As a life-long resident of Boston who has never stayed overnight at a hotel in my own city, I decided to change that and spend a weekend downtown, treating a long-time friend who was visiting Boston. My friend used to live in the area, & has always loved the historic Custom House Tower, so staying at this Marriott seemed perfect. It was- the building is beautifully restored, the suites are spacious, and the view from our 8th floor room facing the harbor was fantastic. Also, one of the best features is the open air observation deck on the 26th floor- I remember visiting it as a teenager, and it still has the best views of the city, which was great to have only an elevator ride away. But despite all of the great things about this historic gem, frankly the most memorable part of the visit was the staff- they truly shine! Everyone was great, and you get the distinct feeling that they are a small family that all enjoy working with each other, and extend that warmth to you, welcoming you to their home if you will. And I would like to mention two staff especially- Yvon, a really helpful staff person who helped us figure out to work the DVD late one night, and whom we ended up having a nice chat with. But if there is one person who is really BORN to her job, it is Karen Connors, the Concierge when we were there. She clearly loves her job, KNOWS her job, and makes you feel like a long lost friend about 5 minutes after meeting her...... and who also has a great sense of humor..... spend some time with her and you'll see what I mean! Even though I only live 6 miles away, I can tell you that after all of the above experiences, I will definitely come back in the future. - Charlie Vasiliades

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find for Families”
Reviews.Author: tartegnin
Reviews.Content: We booked here for a three day stay after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. I had never stayed at a Marriott vacation property before, so probably some of the good features of this stay are common, but they suited us. The hotel is located in the old Customs House, which includes an impressive rotunda and tall tower. Marriott has managed to fit the rooms in around the original features, and our one bedroom "villa" was set around the rotunda. As a result, we had a double height (or maybe, triple!) ceiling with the bedroom set in a loft up a proper staircase. The king size bed was very comfortably, as was the queen sofa bed in the downstairs living area which my daughter slept on. The decor generally was ok - very standard and Marriott, but all decent quality. The room has a kitchenette which was nicely equipped with a microwave, toaster, coffee maker, blender, dishes and a small fridge. There is a small convenience store across the street, so we were easily able to buy milk, cereal, etc. The living area, which was a bit on the small side, had a comfortable pull out couch, an arm chair and a round dining table with four chairs. The room had a nice entry hallway and very good closet space. The bathroom was standard but large, with nice quality bath products. The towels could have been more generous, but were fine. The room was also equipped with an iron and ironing board, as well as a laundry basket. The latter came in handy, as there is a free laundry room (three each of washers and driers) in the small but nice game room at the top of the tower. In addition to the game room, the hotel has a breakfast room/bar, a small but nicely equipped gym and a small play area for young children. There are loads of activities in the hotel, including lectures, concerts and movies, and we were provided with an impressive schedule on check in. We didn't take advantage of any of these, though. The hotel is located very centrally, next to Faneuil Hall and the Aquarium, and easily walkable to other shopping and sites. It's also near a good subway line and taxis were readily available. We found the staff friendly and helpful. Guests have pool access at the Marriott Harbor across the street, but we didn't use this either. All in all, this is a fantastic place in Boston if you're not looking for 5 star luxury. It was very clean and comfortable, and is an ideal hotel either for families travelling on holiday or for business travelers with a longer stay. I tend to be a Four Seasons type of traveller, but for this holiday, the extra room and facilities really made this a better choice, and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Disneyland9timer
Reviews.Content: It couldn't have been any better. We took the short subway ride from the airport- and got out across the street from the hotel. The hotel is so pretty. The location is one block from marketplace, surrounded by great restaurants, and convenience stores. It is a very short walk to the waterfront with amazing parks and walkways along the water. Also a short walk to anything historical and the wonderful Italian North End. The subway is easy to use- walked to Boston Common- Beacon Hill area and just hopped back on subway to get home. Trip Advisor did not steer me wrong- I use this site whenever we travel. Thanks everyone for putting in your input.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but we did not get a superb room... had a fake kitchen!!”
Reviews.Author: Francesca-DM
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel directly through Marriott web site for the price of 189 US$ plus tax. We do know Marriott Vacation Club International because we are members, although we had never traded our weeks with one in Boston before. We stayed only one night, before travelling to Cape Cod. We knew that the one in Boston had only one-bedroom suite (other MVCI resorts feature usually 2 bedrooms). We were given room n. 0206 on the second floor. The room was on two different level: on the upper floor there was the king size bed (really comfortable), and on the first floor there was the kitchen and the living room. The room was overall nice and cozy but not as much as rooms that are shown on both Marriott and MVCI web sites!... So I guess we were given a â€œbadâ€� room because we were staying only one night. But what I did not like at all is that our kitchen was fake! We did have the microwave oven, dishes and glasses but not the hotplates! I was upset since we were travelling with our 16-month son and I had to cook the dinner for him. Fortunately, due to jet lag, he was very sleepy so I solved the problem with a bottle of milk and he fell asleep. The following day we left the hotel. But I would have been really upset about the kitchen if I had stayed longer. The hotel is overall nice and the location is really beautiful. The building itself is a real gem, probably the nicest among Financial District's skyscrapers. One thing I adored was the view from the upper floor of it, which is open not only for the hotelâ€™s guests but for every visitor. It was freezing but the view was incredible!! I would stay at this hotel again in the future, despite the problem I had with the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: aroush1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend with some friends for a milstone birthday party. We were interested in finding a place near Faneuil Hall and the North End for drinks and dinner, but we wanted to find a suite that could accommodate everyone. Well, for the price and size of the room - the Custom House couldn't be beat. Each room can accommodate three people (two on the King size bed and another on the pull-out couch), and the living / dining room area of each suite could comfortably fit eight. It's a terrific place to shop in the daytime; come back to the room and relax with wine, appetizers and friends; catch a view of the sunset over the city from the observation deck; and then head-out for dinner (within easy distance to stumble back to bed)! I should also mention that the hotel is very clean. Also, although we didn't use the staff's services because we're locals, we did see them eagerly assisting tourists (e.g., booking tours, giving restaurant recommendations, helping with parking, etc). There is also a dining room on the second floor of the hotel, which serves breakfast each morning, but we had brought our own food and didn't partake.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Alembic1
Reviews.Content: Top notch rooms and service. You cannot beat this location. Park your car and walk for the rest of your stay. This is the ONLY hotel actually IN Quincey Mkt! Very historic yet modern and up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Boston”
Reviews.Author: Ann-70
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a cold weekend in Boston and must say that this is the best hotel experience I've had in quite some time. I took my son to watch the Celtics vs. Lakers game, at the TD Garden, and seleceted this hotel based on price, location and reputation on Trip Advisor. The three elements on which I based my decision for this hotel were exceeded by far! The price was very competitive to other hotels around the same area, including other Marriott hotels. The location could not have been better, specially considering the temparatutre that we had over the weekend (20F). The historic sites are within walking distance, the best stores are within footsteps and the restaurant variety was superb. As for the reputation on Trip Advisor I think that this hotel was a bit underrrated. This hotel has very big rooms, excellent service throughout the hotel and the most clean and comforable room I've been in a long time. Even though our favorite team lost that weekend, the Marriott Custome House gave me the perfect excuse to go back to cheer for my favorite NBA team again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PetefromRI
Reviews.Content: We just did a one nighter in Boston and decided on staying here after reading the reviews on TA.The Villa was beautiful and it smelled like fresh paint.It was perfect for the two of us and for a couple of none city people we found that we could walk to just about everything safely.A ton of food choices within 15 minutes walk,some just a few steps away.You will be approached by beggars,but we kindly told them no.They all have the same story and I have a feeling that they make a better living then me.They were pretty polite when I said no,just kind of a pain,especially when they kind of blocked restaurant doors.Other than that it was perfect.We will stay here again when staying in the city.We walked to the Commons and Beacon Hill area during the day and stayed around Faniuel Hall at night.Great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jerinct
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a weekend away from work and kids and chose a quick trip to Boston. We were thrilled with the Marriot Custom House. The best part of this hotel was the location. We did lots of activities and never had to get in a car, cab, or subway train. The best part of our trip was the whale watch from Long Wharf Harbor which is about a 5 minute walk. Also had a great dinner at Legal Sea Food!

Reviews.Title: “Expected Greatness, but only Average”
Reviews.Author: RandSBickford
Reviews.Content: I would confirm and amplify many of the positive comments about the Custom House. The location is great, right across from Faneuil Hall and several great pubs and restaurants. The views were super too especially from the observation deck. On the other side of the coin, however, while our expectations were high, out stay was only average. On our first full day, the room was never cleaned by the housekeeping staff until after 6 pm. We even spoke to the staff and asked when it would be cleaned and it took several hours for that to be accomplished. Service, in general, was spotty and inconsistent. We had our daughter out on the couch in the Suite and needed to request blankets and pillows. We also had to request multiple towels several times even though the housekeeping staff witnessed that we have 3 staying in the suite. The Counting Room bar was also a supreme disappointment. The bar itself only has 6 sets then overflows into a lounge area. Neither was at all inviting. We did enjoy the Friday night reception which provided free wine and cheese and socializing even though it was actually a thinly vailed opportunity to sell timeshares. Because we liked to location, we would probably stay at the Marriott Long Wharf across the street. We had a great breakfast there our last morning. A hot breakfast was not available at any price at the Custom House. No fault of the hotel, but the nightlife just outside the Custom house was very very loud on both Friday and Saturday night until 2 or 3 am.

Reviews.Title: “Large and Comfortable accomodations just a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveler5700
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Custom house because of the large rooms and the central locations to many of the landmarks we wanted to see. It was great to have a one bedroom condo setup with everything we'd need. There is even a 24hr convenience store across the parking lot. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable. The view from the top was fantastic. It was a great place to bring a glass of wine and enjoy the sights at one of their tables. The only downside was getting a room on the 4th floor and hearing the partying at the local pubs at night. Our friends in the room next door heard it much more since they were on the side near Fannuel Hall. It was noisy but it didn't keep any of us awake at night. We truly were able to walk everywhere and I highly recommend the Childrens museum (its only a dollar on Friday nights!) and the Aquarium to famillies with small children. We had a great time and would stay again if we were back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but maybe next time I'll bring some earplugs”
Reviews.Author: laxjunkie4life
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel. It's a beautiful building, both inside and outside. The staff couldn't have been nicer. The room was wonderful; very clean. The observation deck allows you to see some breathtaking views of the city, harbor and of Logan Airport. The game room had an air hockey and pool table, along with a few arcade machines. The exercise facility featured a bunch of treadmills along with various weights and such. This hotel is definitely worth it's somewhat high price. I would have given it a five star rating if it wasn't for one thing: the noise at night. Right around midnight each night, the pubs (the hotel is surrounded by them) start releasing their liquored up customers, who don't seem to know how to talk without shouting. You would hear random "HEYYYY" and "DUUUUDE" and various other things that drunk college kids say (yell) to eachother at two o'clock in the morning. I found it somewhat hard to sleep with all the noise outside. The honking from cars didn't help either. Now, I must say that I am a light sleeper; the 3 other people I shared a suit with weren't bothered or woken up by the noise outside. So, if you're a light sleeper, I'd recommend you bring some earplugs or request a room on a high floor. (I was on the 9th floor). All in all I had a wonderful stay; this is where I'll be staying if I ever return to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a little extra money”
Reviews.Author: laconcierge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Boston, and this is the first one that I think is spending the money on. We had a nice one bedroom suite, that still had a nice view on the fourth floor. As far as suites goes it wasn't enormous, but the very high ceilings and nice decor still made it feel a little more posh than your standard room. First hotel I have been to in a while where there were more pillows than you actually needed on the bed. You absolutely cannot beat the location. If you want to be able to walk to all that is lovely and touristy --Fanuel Hall, North End, Aquarium, Night Life than this is the spot. The observation deck was beautiful and at the time we went we were the only ones there. We had fun in the game room too. Hotel staff is friendly and the rooms were clean. Mini fridge was bigger than average. We opted not to bring a child on this trip, but the accomodations/activities are family friendly and would not hesitate to bring a child in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff, beautiful historic building”
Reviews.Author: koppk01
Reviews.Content: Stayed her in mid June on a family trip with our two 15 year olds and had a great time. The location is excellent right next to t Faneuil Hall, the nearby North end and the waterfront. The bar in the building has friendly bartenders that are locals that will tell you about the area. The concierge staff was very helpful. The building is historic and the rooms are well maintained. We at some point may purchase a week of timeshare there. Loved it and loved Boston which is a great walking city.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Views with grumpy teens”
Reviews.Author: goiania123
Reviews.Content: My family just came back from a 5 days trip to Boston. We have been staying at this hotel once a year for over 10 years. We are a family of 5..Mom, Dad, 2 teens and a younger child. There is plenty of room for all of us. Each suite (all rooms are suites) has a mini fridge, microwave, sink, blender, coffee maker, utensils, glasses/plates/bowls. The bathrooms are very spacious with hairdryers and the living rooms have a large sofabed, 2 chairs, a dining table with 4 chairs. Cots and High chairs are available upon request. There Plasmas in both the living area and bedrooms. There is no denying the hotel is gorgeous with the most breathtaking views of the harbor and city of Boston. The location can not be beat, as its literally 10 steps away from Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall and about a 45 second walk to the docks and Aquarium. There are many many restaurants and shopping locations in every direction within seconds of the hotel. there is also a convenience store located across the parking area (25 ft away from front door of hotel) The staff is fantastic. The best Concierge staff in the city. Hotel front desk staff are very informative too. Housekeeping (I think the same woman has been there since they opened their doors), valet/bellhop (again, we see the same friendly faces year after year after year) are fast and friendly. The one draw back is that the hotel has a small lounge and some entertainment at night, they do not have a restaurant (there are a million within steps outside of the hotel) and does not have a pool (you have full privledges a block away at the Marriot Longwarf Hotel). The game room is good for young kids, but my teens were a bit bored with it. There is a weight room and laundry room, both did not appeal to the teens. My teens spent more time down the street at the Mariott Longwarf than they did at the Custom House. My younger child had fun at the Custom House and got to play and do some craft at the Maze, their daily activity center. I recommend this hotel to everyone. Its a must do at least once in a lifetime place!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: dennburr
Reviews.Content: After reading the many positive reviews, I booked the Custom House for 2 nights. They upgraded me to a junior suite on the first floor (102). The suite was quite noisy with the subway under the building and the streets outside. In addition, the cleaning crew used a heavily scented fragrance that was obnoxious. Since I could not open the windows, the smell persisted. After complaining, they switched me to another suite next door, not much better. I left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms. Great hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: ebonaven
Reviews.Content: I am very happy I found this hotel. Stayed for 3 nights and would have liked to stay more. Great location. Right across lots of restaurants, bars and shopping. Rooms are really big and very comfortable, with great king bed in the bedroom, a very good sofa-bed in the living room and a table with chairs. I stayed there with my wife and 3 daughters (2 teenagers and a 4 y-o) and we were very comfortable The gym is great and there is also a playroom and laundry. Great views of the city from the top of the tower. The only issue with the hotel, as many others have mentioned, is the noise from the bar across the street during weekends and also the noice from the cars, ambulances, etc... The first night we were at the 2nd floor and could not sleep at all. Then we moved to the 15th floor and it was a toatally different experience. Complimentary internet and you can also use the swimming pool at another Marriott that is very close. I highly recommend this hotel (unless you stay in a low floor on the wrong side of the building...)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: kiahbear
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. It is beautiful inside and out. I was VERY happy with our accomodations. Boston is a lot like NY in the way of hotel rooms - SMALL. However, the Custom house is an all suites hotel so each room has a kitchen, living room, dining area and separate bedroom. This is VERY hard to come by in Boston. The hotel is right in the middle of all the best Boston has to offer and there is a subway station RIGHT OUTSIDE the main enterance, this in and of itself is amazing. Again, I highly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return, and not hesistate to recommend! Top notch stay...”
Reviews.Author: badsherry
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Custom House, we were promply greeted by the gentleman working behind the desk. Regretfully, I forgot his name, but he was wonderful! We were told that we were upgraded to one of the four (4) "Presidential" suites way up top. I was pleasantly surprised. We did valet park for $38/night and never moved the car. We went to the elevator, and had to step out at the 19th floor, and get on another elevator going to the 24th floor. We walked into our suite, and holy cow! There are just no words that can describe it. When we walked out onto one of two patios, we realized that our room was located right below the clock that is at the top of the tower. As we entered, there were doors that opened to a large deck in front of us, a closet to the left, and stairs to the right that went up to the kitchen/living area. Everything you need is there. Microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot, utensils, plates, etc... Also had a small table where one could eat if they so chose to. There were another set of steps down to the bedroom and bathroom, and another much smaller deck that you could step out on and see the water. All the furnishings were very nice, the room was very clean and comfortable. There was a very small safe in the bedroom closet, which was quite handy to lock up some small items. We did not have any noise problems, or any other problems for that matter. We stayed for two nights, but I wish it would have been a week. This was a very comfortable place to stay. We almost ran into a problem, that was quickly taken care of at check out, and the staff could not apologize enough. We were double charged each night for the valet parking. It was quickly taken off our bill, with a smile. I would not hesistate to recommend a stay at the Custom House, and do plan to return in the future. It is close to the North End and Fenuil Hall. We even walked all the way back from Fenway Park, as it was only about 2 miles. Great stay, great staff...I just can't say enough good about this place! It was the best birthday ever for me! I felt like royalty here... I took plenty of pictures of the room, so please take a peek and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL GREAT CITY”
Reviews.Author: napagirl2
Reviews.Content: I would recommend staying at the Marriott Custom House if you are lucky enough to get reservations this summer. It is so convenient to everything and located near all the great attractions. The hotel is a beautiful historic building. If you happen to be staying there on a Monday, the concierge Karen gives a wonderful tour that lasts about 90 minutes. It starts at 10am. She is very enthusiastic and passionate about Boston and the Custom House. The rooms are larger than most hotel rooms and have a living room, kitchenette, bedroom, bathroom, and area to sit and eat. Each room has a different layout. There are only 5 rooms per floor. The best part about this place is the observation deck on the 26th floor. You can see the entire city and get the best views. It is not open to the public. The "T" station (subway) is located directly outside the hotel. We parked the car (38 bucks a day) and never used the car again. The subways and trolleys are fairly clean and very safe. Boston has become one of my favorite cities. There is so much history and beauty here. I was very impressed with how friendly and helpful the locals were to tourists. There are employees at the T stations who can help you purchase your tickets in the machines. If you are staying for any length of time and plan on using the subway, get the 7 day pass. It is only 15 dollars and is a great deal. It gives you unlimited access to the subway, buses, and one ferry from the wharf to The Charlestown Navy Yard. I would recommend doing the ferry ride because it is nice to see the Boston skyline from the boat. Boston is also "the most walkable city". Since they have finished the Big Dig, this statement is so true. I would recommend walking the freedom trail which has many pubs, and historic places on it. The North End is a 10 minute walk from Custom House. Just use caution when crossing the streets. Some people do not always give pedestrians the right of way. The hotel is also steps away from Quincy Marketplace or Faneuil Hall. This can be good and bad. The good is that you are right in the middle of the action. The bad is that from Thursday-Saturday they have live bands and the noise can be heard in your hotel room from 10-1. We were staying on the 10th floor and our room wasn't even facing the marketplace. It sounded like the band was in our room. The marketplace is loaded with shopping and places to eat and drink. The food court has lobster rolls that are pretty good and reasonably priced. Boston Chowda has great soups and good lobster rolls. Go to Cheers just to drink at the bar. The food is not good. Houston's has a steakhouse here and the food rocks! If you want other restaurant info you can ask the concierge. We also ate at the cheesecake factory near the Prudential Center. The calamari was great. Another tip is not to eat at Legal Seafood. Everyone raves about the food here. We tried it one night and it was nothing special. If you like Italian Pastry then go to Mike's on Hanover Street. The pastry is out of this world. Great Cappuccino too. Giacomo's is a favorite restaurant there but the lines form early as they open at 5pm. They do not take credit cards. Most of the restaurants and places in the North End only take cash so be ready. You will have a great time in Boston and at Custom House. It is a city with a quaint feel. We kept running into the same people throughout the city in different places. Our only bad experience was Fenway Park. Check out my review of Fenway. Take the tour and skip the game if you have to see the ballpark. A local had a good tip on Fenway. Get standing room only tickets. When you read my review, you will understand why. So go check out Boston, you will love it. I can't wait to go back. Another note is that this hotel does not have a pool so if you are traveling with children this could be an issue. You are allowed to use the Marriott Long Wharf pool but you have to walk across the street for that. This was another thing I liked about the hotel. There weren't any screaming kids while we were there. I guess they chose to stay elsewhere. There also isn't a spa or a place to buy groceries on the property. There is a small game room and laundry facility on the 24th floor and a nice gym on the 25th. The Counting Room on the 2nd floor serves a continental breakfast in the morning for a fee and the bar also opens up at 5pm. They have entertainment on some nights.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Custom House/Boston”
Reviews.Author: StartinDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Custom House for 6 nights and 7 days during our honeymoon in Boston. This hotel is beautiful and a must for history buffs. The location puts you literally across the street from the Blue Line train, 2 blocks from the Wharf (where you can pick up water taxi's) and the Aquarium and within walking distance of great attractions like Boston Common, Fanueil Hall, and a short water taxi to Old Ironsides. We were on the 19th floor, you could hear street noise (this is a very old building) but it was no worse than staying downtown in any major city. The view was AMAZING and you have access to the clock tower until about 11pm for an outside viewing of Boston that shouldn't be missed. Laundry facilities were available (washers/dryers for about 75 cents), game room for kids included video games and a pool table, staff was VERY helpful and polite. The location was near many many restaraunts and walking distance to convience stores for anything you forgot. Bed was comfortable and there was a TV in the bedroom and the living room. Decoration was gorgeous and the main room contained a sofa and a small table for eating. Also had a full set up of dishes, small refrigerator, coffee maker, a sink, and cabinets in the kitchenette. Make sure to see the history of the building and get the schedule of events from the front desk - every day the hotel hosts some sort of event from historic talks to tours of the building (which used to serve as the counting house for the US). We took the train everywhere or walked and never ran out of great things to do. Highly recommend that you get a Go Boston card, great deals for a cheap price if you have the time to do a few attractions a day. We were able to go whale watching, to the Aquarium/Imax, on a Duck Tour, toured Fenway Park, and took the trolley around town.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location & even better suite”
Reviews.Author: lilac7272
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded expectations. I don't think you could get a better location - within steps of the freedom trail, the aquarium, quincy market, etc. We changed our plans in order to arrive on the weekend and I think this was a good move since the roads are small & narrow and it's easy to get lost. We parked in the nearby 79 State Street parking garage which was a good move and also very close to the hotel. We ended up on a high level and there were very few suites on the floor which meant it felt very private & quiet. The suite was large & bright & clean with lots of room for 3 adults & 2 small children. The only small complaints were the difficulty in sometimes getting an elevator (and the fact you have to use your hotel room key to get it to work - took some getting used to) & I wish there was a pool even though you're allowed to use the pool at the nearby Marriott. Views were amazing (see attached)...

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marriott Custom House is great”
Reviews.Author: kingair17
Reviews.Content: The custom house is a very interesting place to stay. What can I say ....location is everything. 50 paces to the subway. One block to the Quincy market and 1/4 mile to the best dining in the north end to experience. The concierge Karen Conners is the best at providing information to go on the many site seeing ventures. Dont miss the unofficial tour at Harvard and the tour at Fenway park. The hotel is renovated and you would not know it was over one hundred years old. The beds were harder than I preferred but very large. I only went to the breakfast room once and the waffle batter was not good...I could not eat the waffle. I suspect the staff changed the batter mix that is the usual at a Residence INN. The front desk staff was adequate but not up to par with the vacation club's I have visited in other locations. The problem was with the rental car pick up an the valet staff. They seemed very aloof. Consider calling the concierge before you go to get the lowdown. Don't buy a Boston Go card...ripoff. Learn the subway system. Take it from the airport to the Aquariem station it is fantastic. Get a week pass for 15.00 dollars it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two nights”
Reviews.Author: Gastronauta
Reviews.Content: Part of a 2-week family holiday in the US. Stayed for 2 nights in early August and booked direct with hotel. First night: although we specifically asked for a high-floor, we ended up on the second floor, bar side. This is because, of course, this is not really a hotel but a time-share with occasional availability of rooms and the part-owners want the best rooms. Nothing wrong with that, but the room was not good. Spartan, worn down (reminded me of Eastern European hotels in the 80s) and VERY noisy given pubs across the street. 2*. Fortunately staff at reception managed to move us to the 19th floor the second night: what a difference. Fantastic room, great furnishings, spectacular views.... 4*. In the end we were grateful for the swap and appreciate they were under no obligation to move us but the difference was spectacular and for $400 a night the room on the 2nd floor was a joke. Great top floor 'games' room behind the clock in this famous Boston landmark though. Breakfast was mediocre and a bit weird as room was too small, historic as it was. Overall, I would not stay here again as there is no guarantee of a nice vs rubbish room and overall a mixed experience. Next, off Cape Ann but next hotel was Comfort Inn in Concord.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grainnew
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Custom House for three nights. We are 2 adults and 2 children. I asked for a high floor and we got it - right under the clock face. While the windows were small compared to the lower floors- there were only 2 suites on our floor as the floor plate is smaller at this level. The views stretched from a partial harbour view, North End/Charlestown, Cambridge, partial dowtown, government centre-so the views were good. Overall the suite was small in size (but this is dictated by the floor plate and has to be expected given that this is a clock tower). When the sofa bed was pulled out there was little room to move about, mainly due to too many occasional tables in the living/dining/kitchen area. I had originally requested a rollaway bed (since the girls don't like sharing) but once I saw the size of the room I had to cancel it - it just wouldn't have fitted in. Our room had a king size bed - which left little room for anything else, as this room was small as well. I am generally very fussy about matresses and I can say this one was fine - very firm. The bathroom was off a lobby between both rooms. With four people travelling there was no space for all our bathroom stuff. A shelf over the wash basin would have been good for all that stuff. The extract did not work in the bathroom so one got a foggy mirror. We are very concious about the background noise of air conditioning at night. It was quite noisy and kept switching on/off throughout the night. Another issue was the supply grilles were directly over the sofa bed - so one daughter was cold and we had to request extra blankets for the sofa bed. The observation deck was very interesting as it is external and runs around all sides of the building. Also interesting was the rotunda lobby (with domed ceiling) and upper level (which was part of the original Custom House). The lower floors were all part of the original Custom House and the tower section was an addition about a century ago. There is a laundry in part of the games room which would be very useful for those staying for a longer period or those travelling with small kids. The kitchen was stocked with washing liquid, laundry powder and coffee. There was no stove - just a microwave and a undercounter fridge. As others have mentioned the location is very handy for transportation (three lines are close by), food and shopping. We stayed over a weekend so many of the breakfast places were closed since they mainly serve the downtown office community. However there is a Starbucks just up the street on State. The staff were very helpful and friendly, expecially the guys who take care of valet/bags/doors. I choose this hotel because it was a hotel in an unusual architectural structure (not just an historic hotel- which can mean outdated facilities) and I wasn't disappointed. Expect an adapted reuse of the spaces and you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “unique hotel experience in an historic site”
Reviews.Author: anonymousca
Reviews.Content: retro fit hotel into old customs house in boston, mass, usa. very neat. right next door to quincy market, irish pubs, aquarium, and T- stop. great front desk staff, ice water in the lobby, cookies at 4 pm. great restaurants nearby- legal seafood, wagamama, etc. stately historic hotel. i'd stay again. we stayed in a suite ( family) and it had all kitchen amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good the second time 'round”
Reviews.Author: kckaceykc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before and we absolutely loved it. That time we had a really fantastic (standard) suite on the 19th floor. This time, having booked over the 4th of July (but 4 months in advance), it was a different experience. When we checked in, we were placed on the 2nd floor, which from a view perspective, is terrible. I also booked a suite for 3 people since a friend was going to join us for a few days. However the first room they gave us was totally inappropriate, as there was no separate bedroom. They did move us the next day, but as we found out that night, it was on the 'bar' side of the hotel and being so low, you were woken up each night at 2pm. I was looking for another 'magical' stay, like our first time, but sadly this did not happen. I doubt very much we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: SaraS95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Custom House with my parents and 2 year old daughter. The pull-out sofa was horrible with metal sticking out and a very thin mattress. When we talked to the front desk about it they laughed and said that was what happens over time to these sofas! - Then someone came and dropped an air mattress on the floor without any assistance. The front desk staff was not helpful at all during our stay. The bathroom is in desparate need of renovation as well and the picture quality in the tv awful - again the staff said that was something that could not be helped. To shorten this whole story this was the worst stay we have ever experienced at a Marriott and we checked out three nights early and moved to the Kimpton property NineZero which we loved. The Custom House is in a charming old building but really needs some updating. The hotel is in a great neighborhood and could be very good but is not today.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Boston! 6/29-7/4/2008”
Reviews.Author: njmom23grls
Reviews.Content: What a great stay in Boston! I booked this hotel through an exchange of points and a little cash with RCI. I wasn't sure if this hotel would be "worth it" - boy was I glad I splurged and booked here! The room was huge - about 650 sq feet - which I understand all the rooms are large. The main area had a queen sleeper, a dining table for 4, a counter area with mini fridg, coffee maker sink etc. Dishware in the cupboards for 4. The bedroom had a king bed with lush duvet and 14 (we counted!) pillows! small safe in closet, ample drawer areas and laundry basket. Bathroom was large in size but only a single sink and tub/shower area. This room would have comfortable held a family of four looking to stay in the downtown area and not have to book two rooms. The hotels location was the main reason for booking - as previously reported it is right across the street from the Fanueil Hall/Quincy market area (convenient for food and if shopping - not having to lug packages around all day). Also a 10-20 minute walk from most of the common historic sites (freedom trail sites, Italian area, etc.) Aquarium, splash fountains and so forth. I traveled alone with my daughter and was a little concerned about the number of bars and pubs nearby - but it was really no big deal at all - and we were there during the 4th of July celebration which included several members on shore leave from the Navy and the Marines celebrating at the pubs but it wasn't an issue for us at all. We were on the 19th floor facing the pubs - and the only real noise that bothered me was several fire trucks at a nearby apartment building - but that can't be helped - its city life. My daughter liked the chocolate chip cookies at the reception desk when we checked in and thought it was cool to have the game room - even though several things were out of order. We also spent time on the observation deck looking at the city view and for the falcons that nest on the building. Parking was expensive here ($38 a night) but I parked and didn't move the car during our stay as the Aquarium T stop was right out the front door of the hotel. In Boston we enjoyed the Frog Pond area and make Way for Ducklings at Boston Common, We took two days to explore the sites on the freedom trail up to the bridge over to the USS Constitution and my 10 yo was fascinated by the blanks in history she was able to fill in (plus the National Treasure movies sparked some interest as well). I might have moved along a little more but I didn't want to discourage her from soaking it all up. We liked the foot tour but our very knowledgeable guide the best. (Boston by Foot) Most mornings were a quick pastry and coffee at the nearby Au Bon Pain. We had an ok dinner at Joes recommended by hotel staff - I wouldn't go again but it wasn't horrible. We enjoyed dinner one evening at cafe Florentine in the North End followed by a stop at Mikes Pastry shop for Gelato for daughter and an espresso and Canoli for me. Most of our other meals were eaten in the Quincy Market which had some very good places and some places that were like eating at the food court in the local mall. Overall we had a fantastic stay in Boston and I can't wait to go back. I will surely book this hotel if its available!

Reviews.Title: “Small children love the Custom House!”
Reviews.Author: fjelstad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Custom House from June 29th to July 3rd, 2008. I can't say enough great things about this place. If you can spend the money, stay here with small children! Paid $329 per night on Priceline last -minute for a 1 bedroom suite. Arrived and got a 19th floor harborview 1 bedroom suite which was amazing. 1st time in Boston, traveling with 9 mo old and 4 yr old. Perfect location - Faneuil Hall/Quincy Marketplace, Aquarium/Imax, horsedrawn charriages, trolley and boat tours all within 1-2 blocks. Little Italy, parks with playgrounds within 5 minute walk. Boston Common within 10-12 minutes. T (subway) station and a 24 hr market right out the front door - don't even need to cross the street. Game room with ping pong, air hockey, video games and even a train table (4 yo was in heaven - but BYOT - bring your own trains) on the 24th floor. 26th floor has an observation deck with amazing 360 degree views of city, harbor, accessible ONLY to hotel guests - another awesome perk. Game room has vending machines for snacks and several washers and dryers. Laundry was free to guests and room includes one package of Tide, can buy more at front desk. We did laundry while 4yo played trains! For those without small kids, every evening offered an interesting speaker - wish we could have attended. Downside - breakfast not included, but is offered for a small fee on 1st floor daily. No hotel restaurant, but Faneuil Hall has dozens of restaurants in and out of its food court one-half block away. One tip - best place for baby food and diapers was Rite-aid several blocks away across from City Hall - rest of food could be found at the 24 hr market outside the hotel. Rooms clean enough that I let our 9 mo old crawl on the floor, which I rarely do. Finally, the hotel has their own off-street court for unloading, so no rushed frenzy to load/unload the car and all your stuff with small kids - plenty of space and didn't feel rushed even in peak travel season. Enjoy- this place is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular place, awesome experience !!!!”
Reviews.Author: celtic-panther
Reviews.Content: My wife and children stayed at the Custom House for a week; June 6-13, and had a great experience. It is very close to several inexpensive eateries, parks, wharf, harbour, and historic places. The staff; Anna, Norbit, John, Ellen, Chris, and Karen, GO OUT OF THEIR WAY TO ASSIST YOU. Because it is an historic building, there are no large grounds to roam around like many other Marriott ressorts, but you have all of Boston. My three boys ages 16, 13, and 10 loved the arcade/gameroom and proximity to the aquarium and other places. On the 26 floor is an observation deck....you feel like your on the entire state building, neat experience, and the GYM is great...TV"s on the treadmils! The Custom House is very very clean. One thing is that there is no pool, BUT you can cross the street to the Marriott long Wharf and use their pool, which we did most evenings...very nice pool, with outside sitting deck!! The Custom House is close to some bars; but nice bars, not dives. It can be a bit noisy on Friday and Sat nights, but request a higer floor, we were on floor 23 and heard NO NOISE from the street. We were there during the Celtic-Laker playoffs and LOVED the excitement in the streets. We took the ferry to procincetown, great day trip, and took a very inexpensive limo tour with Antique limo tours; a 1939 cadalac limo, awesome experience, and cheaper than a trolly tour for a famiy of five, and it was a personal of the city! We booked the Custom House as an exchange and had a perfect vacation. The Italian food in the north end is so good.

Reviews.Title: “Custom-ized Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pbi
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent time share property. The room we stayed in on the second floor was refreshingly different. It was a loft suite with the original custom house marble and plaster appointments along with a modern half kitchen. Unlike other reviews, we did not find the furniture to be excessively worn or dated. The 26th floor observation floor was a great feature. The gym on the 25th floor was well equipped and if you feel like a swim you can use the pool at the Long Wharf just across the street. The location is excellent as it is a short walk to Quincy Market and the North End and the Aquarium T stop is right outside the front door. The walk downtown (The Common and Public Garden) is only about 15 minutes. For breakfast try Anthony's Deli about two blocks away across from Columbus Park. And for lunch pick up something at the Golden Goose market in the same direction.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: klrapp
Reviews.Content: A great location, staff and room!

Reviews.Title: “Surrounded by drunks...”
Reviews.Author: RolloOrlando_Florida
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here on a timeshare exchange and have stayed at other Marriott 'resorts' so I know what to expect. The old building is nice to look at; a distinctive hallmark in financial district of Boston and a great location overall from which to walk all over town. Central location both good and bad as what's near in addition to the Harbor, Aquarium, and shopping are noisy, obese tourists, and hordes of buffoonish locals, typically seen either smoking and/or eating, many in various stages of inebriation, (much WORSE at night), wearing Celtics/Red Sox apparel, with shaved heads and multiple tattoos. Local males are just as offensive in appearance. The rooms at the Customs House are large but with typically cheap Marriott furnishings and amenities. For example, there are no glasses in the bathroom and the shampoo/soap are decidedly downscale. Gym on 25th floor is adequate and that term just about describes the entire experience. Activities at the property are typically outsourced and do not expect to get anything useful without paying for it, e.g., no free Internet access, overpriced continental breakfast offerings, exorbitant valet parking charges, only McPaper for morning reading, and limited housekeeping service. You can, however, watch old movies and free TV in a 'special' lounge. Staff very helpful and amiable overall. Were I not able to trade for this space I would never pay what room costs at retail, upwards of 400.00 per night. For those planning to visit and stay in Boston there are probably many more comfortable hotels (Hilton Financial District is one I would recommend) but the downside is that you'll still be in Boston. Go Yankees!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great visit”
Reviews.Author: OP87
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time in Boston for 3 days!The Custom House was a very interesting place to stay. The rooms were beautiful and very large. It was great to have a little kitchen area as we had 2 kids with us. I would stay there again anytime.However, I was a little befuddled why it was rated so highly for children. There is no pool, the game room is a bit lame, and there is no room service or restaurant. The nightlife outside our windows was extremely loud, very late into the night. Our children are not small, so it wasn't too much of an issue for us personally but I found it strange that it is the number 1 rated hotel for children.The elevators were challenging sometimes and if you were staying on the higher rooms or wanted to use the game room, or observation deck you have to change elevators, which were extremely slow. Overall we had a great time, the service was outstanding, the architecture of hotel was so fascinating and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for a Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: RCDC98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Custom House for one night on a quick family vacation. We chose this hotel primarily for its location. Despite being told there was a 4 pm check in time, our room was ready when we arrived at noon. Our original room was located on the second floor, which would have required traveling up and down two small staircases to reach the room. As we planned on using our stroller for most of the trip, we requested another room without stairs. Our request was handled quickly and politely. We made several special requests, including late checkout and extra parking time, which were handled in a similar manner. The staff we dealt with were all extremely courteous and we were very impressed. The hotel itself is beautiful and the location ideal, directly adjacent to Fanueil Hall. The rooms are clean and attractive, and the observation deck, which we visited both during the day and after dark, shouldn't be missed. The kitchenette is a great feature for anyone traveling with small children who need a home base to refrigerate food and serve meals. The street noise, which we read about in reviews, is very audible, but we didn't find late night noise from the bar crowd to be a problem, although our stay took place on a weeknight. The only small disappointment was the fact that the cold breakfast available in the hotel was not included in the room price (which, with taxes and fees, was over $400). Although we received paperwork on timeshare presentations, and there are signs and notices about them in the room and on hotel documents, we did not feel any pressure to attend a presentation. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great location and isn't overly concerned with price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, characterful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cath999
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for many reasons:- Location - extremely central, near the harbor, the aquarium, Quincy market. Rooms - very spacious, comfortable and well-furnished. A separate bedroom and living room, both of a good size, and with enough space for storage. A mini-kitchen with coffeemaker, toaster, blender, fridge, microwave and sink is in the living room. (One very minor point - it would be nice to have had a kettle as well as a coffee-maker!) Ideal for families, as the sofa is a sofabed. Facilities - nice bar, also serving continental breakfast. Games room, laundry room, viewing platform (great views!), fitness area, and use of the swimming pool at another Marriott property close by. Staff - very friendly and helpful - one even helped me carry my luggage down to the subway! Building - a fascinating, beautiful historic place - the sort of thing you can normally only look at on a guided tour, with ropes fencing you off from it. Most highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic!”
Reviews.Author: sierrashoo
Reviews.Content: This is was our fourth visit to the Custom House towers. This time we traveled with my sister and her family. As always, this hotel is just the best for travel with kids. The game room, observatory deck -- even the rotunda in the lobby all provide spaces for people to gather and enjoy each other's company. Plus there is a lot to do right outside the hotel door which, especially for older teens makes for a happy trip! Try to book one of the suites that ends in "02" -- those are most definitely the best rooms in the house, but all are unique and very spacious in their design. My only complaint (and it's a small one) is that over the years, some of the fabric on the chairs and couches are starting to show the wear. Also, what happened to the Boston Globe? Thanks, Custom House, for yet another fantastic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful find”
Reviews.Author: Maine-ah
