Reviews.Content: What a find! Had two suites for ladies getaway weekend. Found after a search on Marriott website, rooms only $193 a night with AAA discount. I know March is slow, but this is a fabulous price for the quality of the facilities and its location. Aquarium T entrance outside the hotel, The Black Rose also right next door, and barely a block to Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall area. Being on the 6th floor, there was some revelry noise from the street late Saturday night (including bagpipers!), but not enough to disturb us too much. We were there the weekend before St. Patrick's Day; it must be wild for the actual holiday! Positives of the room: linens, bath products, spacious living area and kitchenette with coffee, blender, dishes, toaster, etc. Comfortable king bed, typically uncomfortable sofa bed (but I've been on much worse.) One slight negative was the size of the kitchenette - barely enough counter space to slice cheese on, and there really isn't any freezer space in fridge, only tall enough for an ice tray. As long as you don't plan on keeping things frozen (like we had), it's not problem. Ice machine located on upper floor. Encounters with staff were outstanding, from the front desk to the concierge to bellmen to housekeeping. Wonderful security in that you must use room keycard to access elevator and, after 10:00 pm, the hotel entrance. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Big Rooms (1 Bedroom Suite)”
Reviews.Author: plechadores
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Custom House is situated centrally. It is steps away from Fenuil Hall, The Boston Acquarium, IMAX Theater, and other points of interests. The only thing is that the hotel doesn't have a restaurant but right outside the Custom House is Fenuil Hall and there are hundreds of restaurants to choose from. My overall experience at this hotel was pretty good. I would highly recommend this hotel to families.

Reviews.Title: “As wonderful as I had hoped it would be”
Reviews.Author: javabean7052
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott Custom House to celebrate our anniversary. I was able to book a week's stay thanks to a certificate through II which made the vacation very affordable. I had admired photos of this historic building/ vacation club in the very heart of Boston and had read many reviews. There are only about 85+ rooms, all of which are one bedroom suites, in the entire building. The suites were clean, very well appointed, the huge bed was wonderful. Everything was in good working order. Each floor has only 4-5 suites. The open observation deck on the 26th floor affords an outstanding view of Boston and the river. You can view the mechanism of the clock which faces all four directions. Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market are one block away. The staff was helpful and kind. I would highly recommend this location. Be prepared,parking fees are high, the large windows are drafty in the winter, and there are not many "resort" activities for families. Bring your own coffee because they only provide the first pot. But ,Hey, you've got all of Boston at your fingertips and just a few steps away. We did a great combination of resturant dining and take out from Quincy market brought back to the suite. Enjoy. We certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: vb22
Reviews.Content: Every March we usually stay at the Marriott on the wharf in Boston. It is a great time of year - the weather can be everything from the beginning of spring to seemingly like the dead of winter. When making reservations one year we were told they were sold out - and we were offered accommodations at the Marriott Custom House instead. I had visited the Custom House many decades ago as this is where various Federal offices were. I was more than surprised to hear that it had been turned into a vacation property and hotel rooms. You couldn't have a better tourist address in Boston: right outside your door are the historic Faneuil Hall and markets and within a short walk plenty of restaurants, bars, etc. Even better now that the interstate highway is underground here. The Custom House offers valet parking - but I believe your car is then taken over to the Marriott on the wharf. I'm not sure what the current price for parking is but I would expect that you could buy a good meal for whatever it costs. That was about the only downside to staying there. Accommodations are not just rooms - they are complete living suites, like what a nice condo in the centre of a city would offer. Sometimes it's nice to have a living room to relax in with a nice bottle of wine on a raw spring evening! At one time the custom house was the tallest building in Boston - of course that is no longer the case. Still, the views are quite good. And as an extra treat, guests can go up to the outside balcony near the top of the tower. The Marriott Custom House is a bit pricy but given the location, amenities and uniqueness of the facility it is well worth it. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Magical time at The Marriott”
Reviews.Author: BONNYDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Dublin Ireland on our first visit to Boston.The Custom House Marriott was a great choice of hotel.The two separate rooms were ideal as I travelled with my husband and our 16 year old daughter. The fact that there were two TVs helped us all keep our sanity. The kitchen was very well equiped and meant we could help ourselves to breakfast. Housekeeping was excellent with lots of fresh towels. The location of hotel coiuld not have been better.Lots of great places to eat locally. Bertuccis Italian restaurant near Faneuil Hall was a great value lunch venue. We also had a lovely meal at Houstons. A Visit to the North End is well worth while.Here you will find lots of Italian resuarants with great atmosphere and value for money.Our visit to Top of The Hub at the Prudential Centre was also very special. We managed to get a window Table and both the view and the food were excellent. (though a little expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: MOnica9
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely excellent place to stay! A beautiful historical building converted to a suite hotel. Amazing harbor view from our room on the 14th floor, and even better views from the observation deck on the 26th. There is also a well equippped fitness room on the 25th floor. The suite was a 1-bedroom with kitchenette and a dining table with 4 chairs. The location is also excellent near Fanieul Hall and the harbor. There are also several T-staions nearby. This was our first visit to Boston and we loved it. Can't wait to go back, and we will definitly stay at the Custom House again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MyrtleRaleigh
Reviews.Content: Great place and in a great location. There is no food service but it was not a problem. It would have been nice to be in a higher room but we were not time share owners. Overall, we had an excellent time and would highly recommend it. We traveled by subway and could not have been in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: detjason
Reviews.Content: Although I researched and read the previous reviews, I was still overwhelmed with this property. The building is a historical landmark and has a special feel to it because of its history and uniqueness. It is the only Marriott timeshare in a big city. I cant emphasize enough what a great location this is, within steps of so many things. Quincy Market, with at least 25 restaurants is steps away. Subway stops, aquarium, children's museum, and many other attractions close by. Not only do you not need a car, you really dont want one ($36 parking fees). I have stayed at 12 different Marriott timeshares and this one is really a gem. Although all of the rooms are only 1 bedroom (as opposed to 2) with a separate living and sleeping rooms, and dining table, the rooms seem so much bigger. They indicate 650 square feet, but I think ours was bigger. The kitchenette has a microwave, medium size refrigerator, sink and all plates and silverware (no stove). Not only is every room a view room, I think many have two views because there are only 4 rooms per floor (4 corner rooms). Therefore, our living room had two huge windows facing one direction and our huge bedroom window faced another. It felt like a penthouse suite. Usually, if I ever come back to a location, I try to stay in a different hotel to get a different experience. But if I ever come to Boston, I will do my best to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Historic Boston at Marriott's Custom House”
Reviews.Author: Mayhem
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Custom House is the perfect base from which to explore historic Boston. The beautiful granite clad structure is part of that history and the tower is probably the city's most recognizable landmark standing watch over Boston Harbor. You can even take-in a historic actor role-playing in the regal "counting room" where armed sentries once stood on guard as tariffs and duties were tabulated. The Custom House was originally located directly on the harbor but centuries of development and landfill have added a few short blocks. Boston is a walking town. Don't rent a car in the city unless absolutely necessary. Parking fees are outrageous and public transport abounds. We took the train from the airport to within a block of the Custom House. Even more fun was taking the water taxi back to the airport at the end of our week-long stay. We never missed not having a car including our day trips via train to the JFK Museum, town of Quincy and beyond. You can also take a ferry to Cape Cod. The hotel consists entirely of (80) one-bedroom, hi-ceiling, well maintained (time share) suites with king bedroom and pullout in the separate living room. There is a dining table and the kitchenette is perfect for basic provisions and leftovers but not conducive to any real cooking. Countless restaurant options at every price point are within a few short steps of the property including Quincy Market right across the street and the Italian North End and Harbor districts just a bit further. The accommodations are perfect for a couple or business person's extended stay but will get a little cozy for a family of more than three or four. The only inconvenience is the dimly lit cave-like bathroom. Included are some pictures of our suite and fabulous views from the north-east facing windows. (sorry, view images are not downloading--will try again later) You can experience 360 degree views from the outdoor walkout on one of the top floors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Custom House”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Are_Best
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of March early April for a week end with 2 children. Very impressed with the hotel and the location. Staying with children for a week end we did not worry about the lack of full blown restaurant facilities as we got what we needed for breakfast across the road and used the mini kitchen in the room. Next time in Boston I will be staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: barnhok
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally a landmark in Quincy market area--the gleaming tower is easy to find and close to the Aquarium, the Old State House, Faniuel Hall, the North End (Italian area, Revere House and Old North Church) and lots of restaurants, shops, etc... The rooms are large and well laid out for a family of four. The rollaway for our son was free, and our daughter slept on the sofabed. The separate master bedroom was lovely and the bed was comfortable, decked out with nice quality sheets and duvet. There was a microwave, mini-frig and small sink in the dining/living area and also a few dishes. The table and 4 chairs were nice, as we were so close to Quincy market that we could walk back to the hotel room in less time than it took to find a table for our family (the market was very crowded) to eat our lunch. Although the furnishings were a bit on the "fancy" side, they were not in brand new condition, which actually made us feel more comfortable. It's well worth a trip up to the 24th-26th floors to check out the excercise room, the game/laundry floor and the 26th floor which features information about the history of the building and an observation deck. The pool at the Marriott Long Wharf was a 5 minute walk away (outside) and easy to access with our room key from the Custom House. They have small, but fully equipped locker rooms with shampoo, soap, combs, blow dryers, etc... so that you don't have to bring all of this over from the Custom House. The only hitch with our stay was that we were originally booked into a room on the first floor. It was really beautiful, with tall, tall ceilings, marble walls and architectural features from the original building. There were only 2 rooms on the floor as there was a large open rotunda down to the lobby, sales offices for the time-share feature and the club room. The windows in our room had extra insulation to keep street noise to a minimum (we heard none while we were in the room) but unfortunately, an event had been booked for the "public areas" of the floor, including the club room for the evening. It was supposed to be over by 9pm, which was still a little disruptive to us (we were jet-lagged, having flown from the West Coast the night before), but by 10 pm, it was still so loud that we could not hear our rented movie without turning the sound up full blast. We had called the desk twice to inquire about the noise, but finally went down and requested a room on a higher floor. The desk clerk immediately and apologetically found us another room on the 7th floor and sent up someone to move our bags and a new rollaway. She also gave us an appropriate monetary credit for our inconvenience, without my requesting it. I was very impressed by this handling of the issue, though felt they should never have assigned us the 1st room since they had an event scheduled for the evening in areas adjacent to the room. This was apparently a disconnect between guest services and the events group which should be addressed. The room on the 7th floor was much the same as the one on the 1st floor, without the super high ceilings and marble walls. The view was better but without the insulation in the windows, it was very noisy as the bars/clubs let out between 1:30-2:30 a.m. on Saturday night/Sunday morning. The following night was very quiet. . At least 3 people working at the desk apologized to us for the inconvenience, at different times. This was much appreciated by my family and went a long way to correcting the issue and made them seem like a very professional operation. The concierge was also very helpful and sent us to a great, family friendly reasonably priced little Italian restaurant ("Rabia's) that we would not have known about without her suggestion. We paid $219/night for a special weekend rate, through the Marriott website, which seemed quite reasonable given the quality of this property and the location. Despite our 10 pm room change, we would reommend this memorable hotel to anyone who wants a premium location and a great room .

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SIXIRON1946
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Customs House for four days over the St. Patrick's Day weekend. The location is superb and the building is fabulous. We stayed as a time share trade through Interval International. The unit (bedroom and separate living area) were very nice. The staff was very helpful and professional. All in all it was a great stay. I would choose it again for my next trip to Boston. I give it a high recommendation, especially if you are staying for more than a couple of days. There is cozy bar on the 2nd level and a European breakfeast served (small charge). It is within walking distance of many restaurants and pubs. Recommend the Ruth Chris Steakhouse located in the Old Boston City Hall a couple of blocks away -- great food and beautiful setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, wonderful architecture”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler74
Reviews.Content: This is a true gem. They have done a great job preserving the features of the Customs House. The rooms were huge and comfortable. There were full kitchens and a seperated bedroom for comfort. It was also 2 blocks from Fanueil Hall. Can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: UKCowgirl
Reviews.Content: Customs House has the 'feel' of a five star hotel, with attentive, pleasant staff and the beauty of an excellent landmark building, with solid walls, huge windows, marble windowsills. Our room was so very comfortable, with crisp sheets and towels and obviously excellent housekeeping. We loved our views of the market , the harbour and the North Church. Going to the observation deck was a treat. The location was the best, as described by others. We, too, could hear noise,on the 7th floor, but nothing that one wouldn't hear in any major city. It certainly did not wake us up or keep us awake. Would we stay here again? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Family”
Reviews.Author: jmcb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with husband and two teenage children for 4 days at start of November. Picked this hotel after extensive research and the reviews on Trip Advisor. Was not disappointed. Our room was on the 8th floor (I had requested higher but I believe these are kept for the Marriott timeshare people). Now, this is a Club Hotel residence - no restuarant and no real bar to speak off. This suited us perfectly. Room was a one bedroom suite at rate of 299 dollars a night. Bedroom not that large with slight view of harbour. Living area had pull out queen sofa which was perfectly adequate for the kids and a lovely little kitchen area was was perfect for making coffee and breakfast smoothies (have to add that kitchen is pretty well stocked with appliances). 2 Tvs also. Staff unobtrusvie but room always well cleaned. Lounge on frist floor served buffet breakfast in morning but with Quincy market just across road there is no need to eat in hotel. Downside is that the Black Rose pub across the road can get quite noisy at night and it is about a 10 to 15 minutes walk to Newbury street or the italian quarter. On the plus though it is just beside the harbour with all its lovely restaurants and right beside a T stop. All in all I found this hotel perfect for our needs - that of a family of four. Also, the kids were able to use the Pool in the Custom Harbour (Wharfside) for free as it is a sister hotel. Would be very happy to recommend this hotel. Regards, Dublin Trip Advisor Member

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel with great location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: blasketisland
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review of this hotel. Offers great value in a great location, right next door to Quincy Market. Stayed here in Dec 06. Paid the standard 225$ and as we were travelling from Ireland this translated to about 32% less due the the currency at the time, so we thought it was good value. We had a loft style room on the second floor. We loved it. Pop down to Quincy for some smashing food within ten secs of the front door of the hotel. THe T is also right outside the hotel door across the street, which is a great bonus for getting around town. The free internet access was great too. We didnt use the bar or dining room in the hotel as we ate out mostly, so I cant comment on that personally, but did hear others praising it. Anyone looking for a great location and hotel in Boston should check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, First Trip To Boston”
Reviews.Author: texan75225
Reviews.Content: I booked this property based on Trip Advisor reviews. We booked two nights at the Customs House. Was only disappointed in the fact that the room was not as great as it could have been. Upon booking directly with the hotel, I requested a high floor, harbor view as it was my family's first trip to Boston. Called again before departure to make this request, but sadly was given a mediocre room and the only harbor view was a tiny port-hole of a window from the master bedroom. Overall, the room was not bad. There was a decent-sized bathroom between the master bedroom and sitting room (with sofa pull-out). There was a small kitchenette area and a small round dining table. The traditional decor was sort of blah. However, the location was the best. We had a rental car as we were looking at colleges. It was easy to drive in and out with good valet service. The hotel, being a landmark, was easy to find when driving in the city. Also, it was easy to get onto the freeway from the hotel. For walking around the city, the hotel was perfect. It was in a safe, upscale area of downtown near many of the major sights. I felt safe walking with my family at night for dining. I felt safe walking in the afternoon with my daughter shopping. I was pleased and would stay here again based on the wonderful location, and ease of getting to different areas in the city and out of the city. I also thought the rate was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, needs renovations”
Reviews.Author: TripLover321
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October for a weekend at the Marriott Custom House. Staff was pleasant and accomodating, personable and always smiling. However, the room was substandard. For the price, I expected a bit more. The decord was dated. Aside from a not particularly comfortable bed, my main complaint was that there was a stain on the carpet. I don't even want to know what the stain was! Overall, a fine stay. I'm just surprised that this hotel has not updated all of its rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: Sweet_Tea2
Reviews.Content: My DH and I just returned from a trip to Boston. We stayed 2 nights at the Custom House. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We requested a crib for our 2-year-old, and it was in the room when we arrived. We stayed on the 21st floor....the noise level is still high at that level. I found that it does help some to pull the heavy drapes closed. But if you are at all sensitive to noise, you might be better off staying in a more residential area of Boston. I would stay there again. It's a convenient location. The rooms are very nice and roomy...and roominess is hard to come by in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, Did not live up to expectations...”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Columbus Day weekend with our two children and basically it was not worth the money we spent. The location: excellent, walkable to the Aquarium, right near Quincy Market and coffee/bagel shops. The lobby: nice lobby, friendly check -in staff and it was a very quick check-in. The room: When I called I had requested a room as high up as possible, we ended up on the 6th floor. Not a big deal, but dissapointing just the same. When we first walked in, we were happy about the size of the living room area, there was a table with four chairs, a little kitchen area with a sink and lots of cabinets, dishes, coffee pot, and microwave and refridgerator. The bedroom was tiny, barely enough room to get around the bed which we thought was hard and not very comfortable. The pull out couch was awful, our two kids slept on it, but the mattress was bent and dipped down in the center. The bathroom was okay, nice size, but could use some updating, The whole room needed to be repainted as the paint was just chipped off in a lot of areas throughout, the worst part of the room was the filthy carpets, they either need to be steam cleaned or totally replaced. After walking around in our room in clean white socks (one person had grey socks on) we noticed that the bottom of our socks were black. It was pretty disgusting. For $385 a night and $365 (AAA discount) a night, we would expect a cleaner room and a better maintained room. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect Spot for exploring Boston”
Reviews.Author: chas1954
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the Marriott Custom House several times, starting back when it first opened. Each stay has been memorable, and we look forward to our next visit in November for thanksgiving. Everything is perfect at this property. It is a small distance to anywhere in town, and the area around the Custom House has grown, so there are a few places to eat within a block ( there isn't a restaurant on site) Overall you cannot miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But Beware Do Not Stay on the Second Floor”
Reviews.Author: jodibeth
Reviews.Content: We loved our 1-bed room suite and had a wonderful time... EXCEPT the noise from the street---- I didn't sleep at all and in fact we cut our trip short and left a day early. We were on the second floor and heard EVERYTHING outside from screaming kids to horns beeping all night long. I wish I had read the prior e-mail regarding outside noise, I would have asked for a room located much higher. The concierge was extremely helpful and very nice. The workout room was very small but it had very good aerobic machines to use and was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: TheLintner
Reviews.Content: Location, room, comfort, style. This hotel is one of the top we have stayed in. The big king size bed, the 2 tv's the welcome kit was great. When we checked in I told reception, is this room high enough that the street noise won't affect us. They said we should be ok. Well, I don't know if the Stanley Cup or the World Series could be won in the summer but it felt like it. Wow, party animals! Fine but don't tell me the 6th floor should be OK when in fact it is one of the lowest floor...Woke the family up...Beware, ask for better than 6th floor, at least on a Saturday night. Also, bring your own food, no room service at all... Otherwise, Boston is such a great place and the hotel was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MJWJ
Reviews.Content: This review is like so many I read before making a reservation at the Custom House - our stay totally exceeded our expectations. Our family of 4 (including 2 young children) stayed for 3 nights. The location was amazing - literally on top of Fanuel Hall and the waterfront area. Our room had amazing views and the room was a one-bedroom suite with a kitchenette with plates, glasses, etc., 2 tvs, large bathroom and tub, lots of closet space....we had friends stop by and there was plenty of room to entertain. The game room and exercise room were much better than I anticipated and having FREE laundry was a bonus (did I mention free?!). Yet another bonus was that continental breakfast was served for a minimal fee - $2.50 for a Belgian waffle was the highest price. They do not have room service. Also a lovely bar for drinks. We will never stay anywhere else when we return to Boston annually. We did miss having pay movies. It is a Vacation Club Timeshare property so you will get a call about that but they weren't pushy or bothersome. FYI - apparently they hold the higher floors for timeshare owners so they can't guarantee a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Peregrine Falcons”
Reviews.Author: KenVicLee
Reviews.Content: The acclaim is universal; the service, the location, the rooms. What no one has mentioned is the birds! After a week in Maine we needed just one night for a family of four. When I asked the Marriott Waterfront if there was an alternative to renting two seperate rooms at their hotel for my wife, me and two college aged daughters, they recommended the suites in the Custom House, 650 sq. ft. of room. And the price was right, only $315.00 a night. We could not possibly have imagined how delightful the stay would be. We occupied one of only two rooms on the 21st floor, each a suite occupying half the footprint of the building. I believe our floor was the only one that had private balconies. Not one but two overlooking Boston. But back to the birds, posted on the door of each balacony was a warning that the building was the site of a peregrine falcon nest and sure enough, we shared the 21st floor with these beautiful birds. While one daughter read on a ledge 21 floors above the bustling town, the other daughter was busily photographing the falcons in their comings and goings. At one point the obviously unfazed falcons were seen working over a crab they had caught in the harbor, all of about 30 feet away. Our entire stay was more than we could have expected but the highlight was our neighbors. Don't forget to look up when you are sight seeing on the 26th floor because you might see the real tenants of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Getzmrt
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The location was incredible, next to Quincy Market & Fanuel Hall. The T stop was just outside the door and all of downtown was in walking distance. The suite was beautiful, with all of the amenities. The staff was friendly and helpful. We also enjoyed the view from the top floor and our teenagers loved the game room.

Reviews.Title: “Agreement”
Reviews.Author: LSBurdett
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to write a quick review of the Custom House. We stayed on the fifth floor and also were bothered by noise from folks coming out of the bars and cars honking at them on Saturday night. Sunday, Monday and Tuesday nights wasn't a problem. We also appreciated the free washer and dryers available at the hotel. Otherwise we concur with the other recent reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: David777
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Marriott Custom House and it certainly lives up to its earlier postive reviews in Trip Advisor. Superb location right next door to Aquarium subway station - two stops down from the Airport. Within a short walking distance of Freedom Trail and old market area where there are many restaurants / cafes and food halls - particularly recommend the lobster rolls and clam chowder. Boston harbour about 5 mins walk from hotel. Make sure you go to the top of the tower and see the 360 degree viewing platform - fantastic views of Boston and surrounding area. Restoration of Custom House has been carried out very well - keeping many of the original features including Counting Room and original internal dome. Make sure you ask for a higher floor room though - the hotel area is surrounded by several bars which can be noisy at closing time - and preferably a view towards Boston harbour - you can see the planes taking off and landing in the distance from Logan airport plus the boats coming in and out of the harbour. Highly recommend the Freedom Trail although currently badly signposted where they've recently buried the Interstate road - don't bother trying to see the Bunker Hill monumment in Charlestown - its closed for refurbishment!

Reviews.Title: “amazing service - great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Custom House was amazing. Our room was a huge suite, just as pictured on the website. Our room was 1 of 2 located on the first floor. This room is basicly in a museum. You walk up one level from the lobby into the Peabody Essex Museum, turn left - and there was our suite. The staff at this hotel was phenominal, answering any and all questions. The front desk staff was also very helpful with late night dining suggestions. I tried to tip one particularly helpful member of the staff when we checked out - and he respectfully declined. The location is perfect, and literally adjacent to the aquarium subway stop. To prevent confusion: I had seen some other reviews that said daily maid service was an extra fee. This is only if you are using timeshare points to pay for your room. If you reserve through the marriott website and pay a nightly rate, there is free maid service just like any other hotel.
